I'm used to disappointing breakfast burritos with more eggs and tortilla than anything else but this burrito was all pulled pork and bacon delight!
and the egg was there to compliment the meat.
DUDE this is the real deal !
Add in cheddar is one of my top choices of cheese and it's been a great Sunday morning already.
Ordered picked up avoid the lines.
Took 5 minutes.
Thanks bacon bacon.
A+
the breakfast burrito.author: Christian C.
the breakfast burrito.review: Ordered the breakfast burrito to go. Oh man is this good! it's pulled pork, eggs, cheddar cheese, guacamole, a green pepper, and BACON! I'm used to disappointing breakfast burritos with more eggs and tortilla than anything else but this burrito was all pulled pork and bacon delight! and the egg was there to compliment the meat. DUDE this is the real deal ! Add in cheddar is one of my top choices of cheese and it's been a great Sunday morning already. Ordered picked up avoid the lines. Took 5 minutes. Thanks bacon bacon. A+

excerpts: Ordered the breakfast burrito & parm fries.
Both delicious.
Very pleasant staff and nice simple neighborhood gem.
Relaxed.
.take& go recommendation.
the breakfast burrito.author: Sharine d.
the breakfast burrito.review: Very clean, advertised on yelp as breakfast...I'd suggest more lunch focused. Ordered the breakfast burrito & parm fries. Both delicious. Very pleasant staff and nice simple neighborhood gem. Relaxed. .take& go recommendation.

excerpts: The breakfast burrito is always the move.
Don't be fooled by the food trucks, this is the real deal.
Bacon, avocado, egg, pulled pork, pepperoncini, cheese.
This will save you from any hangover and fill you until dinner for 8 bucks and some shitty change.
the breakfast burrito.author: Mark M.
the breakfast burrito.review: I eat here every weekend because it's that good. The breakfast burrito is always the move. Don't be fooled by the food trucks, this is the real deal. Bacon, avocado, egg, pulled pork, pepperoncini, cheese. This will save you from any hangover and fill you until dinner for 8 bucks and some shitty change.

excerpts: I guess I'll just stick to the breakfast burrito from now on.
the breakfast burrito.author: Cathy N.
the breakfast burrito.review:
I come here every time trying something new. This time, I got a Cuban sandwich off their new menu. 

Unfortunately, it wasn't anything special. The bread was kind of dry so that ruined the sandwich for me. The turkey in it was okay and the bacon was just okay. I guess I'll just stick to the breakfast burrito from now on.

excerpts: I had the breakfast burrito - it was OK, nothing spectacular.
There was not that much bacon in it.
the breakfast burrito.author: Rico R.
the breakfast burrito.review:
I had the breakfast burrito - it was OK, nothing spectacular. There was not that much bacon in it. For a place called Bacon Bacon, there should be ALOT of bacon, but this is not the case here.

The bacon fries was another case of lacking in bacon. It was more like Carnitas with some bacon bits. We asked for well done fries which they followed and the fries came out very nicely and tasted great.

Another low mark is their system - they will take orders from a long line of customers, cook a lot of burritos, prepare all the sandwiches ordered then release them in no particular order. You got your food randomly. We ended up being served last in a batch of about 10 people and we were there first!

Not worth going back.

excerpts: My bf and I entered the tiny eatery already knowing what to order: the breakfast burrito.
Though seemingly small in size, it is packed to the brim with scrambled eggs, avocado, cheese, bacon and, the piece de resistance; pork shoulder.
One hearty bite
and I was in bacon heaven.
the breakfast burrito.author: Elsa K.
the breakfast burrito.review:
On my first day in SF, I woke up jet lagged and, most importantly, starving. A quick search on Yelp lead me to nearby Bacon Bacon, which was simply serendipitous since I was badly craving some porky goodness. 

My bf and I entered the tiny eatery already knowing what to order: the breakfast burrito. Though seemingly small in size, it is packed to the brim with scrambled eggs, avocado, cheese, bacon and, the piece de resistance; pork shoulder. One hearty bite and I was in bacon heaven. A few bites later I spotted bottles of hot sauce (Sriracha & a mexican brand) and couldn't resist the urge to add some spice to the meat bonanza.

Keep in mind that the place is very small, with limited seating. We went on a late Saturday morning and had to wait around 10min for space to free up and it did get pretty crowded. 

I definitely plan on making a few more visits to Bacon Bacon (either the B&M location or the food truck) to try more menu items. I'm especially looking forward to the bacon flight!

excerpts: The breakfast burrito with bacon AND pork shoulder is wonderful.
The first bite melting in your mouth is divine!
Totally worth the calories.
the breakfast burrito.author: J D.
the breakfast burrito.review: The breakfast burrito with bacon AND pork shoulder is wonderful.  The first bite melting in your mouth is divine! Totally worth the calories.

excerpts: I went in the morning for the breakfast burrito, came across the food truck on Fishermans' Wharf and decided to have the fries.
Both were very delicious.
the breakfast burrito.author: C B.
the breakfast burrito.review: I went in the morning for the breakfast burrito, came across the food truck on Fishermans' Wharf and decided to have the fries. Both were very delicious.

excerpts: And as if there wasn't enough pork, there was shredded pork shoulder in the breakfast burrito that was cooked and simmered to the point of melting in my mouth.
the breakfast burrito.author: Kevin T.
the breakfast burrito.review:
*everything about bacon done right*
#pork
#50shadesofbacon

"Order quietly, Steph has a hangover", said the sign in front, and I completely agreed with it due to my cocktail flu. However from my parking spot 2 blocks away, the strong aroma of pork gently revived me until I was standing in front of the store. 

This place is exactly what you'd expect from a place called Bacon Bacon. Think any sandwich, burrito, salad, ice cream sandwich, whatever with a nice thick slice of bacon. This is no Denny's 1/16" think slice of bacon, but a solid hefty meal in itself. For the purists, you can order a "bouqet" of bacon which is exactly what you think it is. 

I ordered the bacon burrito which albeit small, had a generous serving of avocado in it. And as if there wasn't enough pork, there was shredded pork shoulder in the breakfast burrito that was cooked and simmered to the point of melting in my mouth. 

My friend's sandwich was a little bit dry, but no worries, we got a side of baconnaise with big fat bacon chunks in it. 

To top it off they had some great coffee to settle all the bacon you just consumed. A great place and great menu for bacon enthusiasts and casual bacon-ners. Could use some seating, oh and maybe leave a bottle of the bacon hot sauce for all to try!

excerpts: Tried the breakfast burrito.
It was delicious on the greasy side
and I really only should have eaten half, but I have to say I thought it was one of the best I've had.
the breakfast burrito.author: Diana E.
the breakfast burrito.review: Tried the breakfast burrito.  It was delicious on the greasy side and I really only should have eaten half, but I have to say I thought it was one of the best I've had.

excerpts: The breakfast burrito was delicious and my son had a hamburger that was juicy and super delicious.
Will come again for sure!
the breakfast burrito.author: Karen G.
the breakfast burrito.review: First time here and the food was amazing!   The breakfast burrito was delicious and my son had a hamburger that was juicy and super delicious.    Will come again for sure!

excerpts: The breakfast burrito is a tasty tube of pork, but if you're not hungry enough to handle it, the taco is a tasty alternative.
the breakfast burrito.author: Niels ..
the breakfast burrito.review: Great food at great prices. This is our go-to neighborhood breakfast nook every weekend. The breakfast burrito is a tasty tube of pork, but if you're not hungry enough to handle it, the taco is a tasty alternative.

excerpts: Get the breakfast burrito!
Half of it was cold, oddly.
Do not get the breakfast
burger--
it's tiny and not as yummy.
the breakfast burrito.author: Cat C.
the breakfast burrito.review: Quick foodies and service is ok. Get the breakfast burrito! Half of it was cold, oddly. Do not get the breakfast burger-- it's tiny and not as yummy.

excerpts: we got the breakfast burrito, the fried chicken sandwich, and
the Bird - everything was amazing!
great flavors without being too salty or "fatty" tasting.
friendly and great service - can't wait to go again and try more things!
the breakfast burrito.author: Hannah H.
the breakfast burrito.review: SO GOOD! we got the breakfast burrito, the fried chicken sandwich, and the Bird - everything was amazing! great flavors without being too salty or "fatty" tasting. friendly and great service - can't wait to go again and try more things!

excerpts: I jumped in with the breakfast burrito - a cornucopia of goodness anchored by pork shoulder and highlighted by avocado and pickled peppers.
L opted for the very extra special veggie frittata on bed of bacon bacon with sliced tomatoes and greens.
Three days later I woke in a post-holiday fog pondering bacon and ventured out in the city clouds to gather another burrito from this little protein haven.
I am truly thankful.
the breakfast burrito.author: Andrew A.
the breakfast burrito.review: A joyful surprise as we wandered from Corona Heights to NoPa our first morning visiting relatives for thanksgiving. I jumped in with the breakfast burrito - a cornucopia of goodness anchored by pork shoulder and highlighted by avocado and pickled peppers. L opted for the very extra special veggie frittata on bed of bacon bacon with sliced tomatoes and greens. Three days later I woke in a post-holiday fog pondering bacon and ventured out in the city clouds to gather another burrito from this little protein haven. I am truly thankful.

excerpts: My husband loved the breakfast burrito & the almost veggie sandwich was to die for, especially on the toasted brioche.
We also picked up two chocolate chip bacon cookies on a whim-- delicious!
If we lived in the area we would definitely make this a (terrible) habit.
the breakfast burrito.author: Savannah K.
the breakfast burrito.review: Service was fantastic - super friendly! My husband loved the breakfast burrito & the almost veggie sandwich was to die for, especially on the toasted brioche. We also picked up two chocolate chip bacon cookies on a whim-- delicious! If we lived in the area we would definitely make this a (terrible) habit.

excerpts: I had the bahn mi one day and went back for the breakfast burrito the next.
Both came out fast and were fantastic.
Combine great food with great prices and super friendly staff and you've got a winner.
Thanks Bacon Bacon, for keeping it real and knowing what it's all about.
the breakfast burrito.author: John B.
the breakfast burrito.review: I was staying with a friend who lives near Buena Vista park and was lucky to find this place for a late breakfast/lunch. I had the bahn mi one day and went back for the breakfast burrito the next. Both came out fast and were fantastic. Combine great food with great prices and super friendly staff and you've got a winner. Thanks Bacon Bacon, for keeping it real and knowing what it's all about.

excerpts: We ordered the BBQ Pulled pork sandwich and the breakfast burrito, side of porky fries.
The sandwich was packed with three styles of pork, pulled, belly, and bacon.
The sauce was on the sweet side.
The roll nothing special
but I didn't feel it was grocery store quality either.
Not the best pulled pork I've ever had, but definitely up there.
The breakfast burrito was very good.
Eggs nice and hot.
Needed more avocado, would have paid more if I knew there would be so little.
The side of porky fries was ok, really the reason I couldn't stretch the review to be a five star, that and each item was good but not the best ever.
the breakfast burrito.author: Andrew G.
the breakfast burrito.review: Got lucky and arrived in time with no line, by the time our food came out the place was packed.  That was a big bonus.  We ordered the BBQ Pulled pork sandwich and the breakfast burrito, side of porky fries.  The sandwich was packed with three styles of pork, pulled, belly, and bacon.  The sauce was on the sweet side.  The roll nothing special but I didn't feel it was grocery store quality either.  Not the best pulled pork I've ever had, but definitely up there.  The breakfast burrito was very good.  Eggs nice and hot. Needed more avocado, would have paid more if I knew there would be so little.  The side of porky fries was ok, really the reason I couldn't stretch the review to be a five star, that and each item was good but not the best ever.  The fries were nice and crispy, but not enough of them.  The pork thrown in was a good sampling, but nothing really stood out.  Next time I'll just order the regular fries because I probably will get enough pork on the other menu items.

excerpts: The breakfast bowl and the burrito were great.
Took awhile for the order
but the wait was worth it.
I ordered to-go and enjoyed it at home.
The staff was friendly.
the breakfast bowl.author: Christina M.
the breakfast bowl.review: I love bacon just as much bacon bacon loves bacon. The breakfast bowl and the burrito were great. Took awhile for the order but the wait was worth it. I ordered to-go and enjoyed it at home. The staff was friendly.

excerpts: We ordered the breakfast bowl which had eggs, bacon, pulled pork, onions and avocado, it was amazing!
We also split the Mac and cheese bacon balls, they come with four and a chipotle dipping sauce!
The restraint is small, maybe seating for about 20 or so within tables on four, but definitely delicious and worth going to try if you love bacon
like I do.
the breakfast bowl.author: Alicia D.
the breakfast bowl.review: Bacon bacon is the bacon lovers heavon! Bacon is in everything on the menu! We ordered the breakfast bowl which had eggs, bacon, pulled pork, onions and avocado, it was amazing! We also split the Mac and cheese bacon balls, they come with four and a chipotle dipping sauce! The restraint is small, maybe seating for about 20 or so within tables on four, but definitely delicious and worth going to try if you love bacon like I do.

excerpts: Tried the breakfast bowl.
Really yummy, but it felt like half a serving, for $7.
Coffee was alright.
Small space, but at least they have a restroom (upstairs).
the breakfast bowl.author: D M.
the breakfast bowl.review: Tried the breakfast bowl. Really yummy, but it felt like half a serving, for $7. Coffee was alright. Small space, but at least they have a restroom (upstairs).

excerpts: The coffee is very good (BIG plus) and the sandwiches are great, but I went with the Breakfast Bowl.
It is small, but delicious and filling.
The space is small and has limited seats, so get there early or be prepared to take out.
the breakfast bowl.author: Afshin A.
the breakfast bowl.review:
Everything Bacon!

I ran into an article in the Chronicle about Bacon Bacon opening at a new location near AT&T Park. I had never heard of them, so I thought I check them out at their current location in Upper Haight and that is how we ended up having breakfast here.

The coffee is very good (BIG plus) and the sandwiches are great, but I went with the Breakfast Bowl. It is small, but delicious and filling. The space is small and has limited seats, so get there early or be prepared to take out. The young man behind the counter was very personable and nice.

If you want a taste of delicious bacon, visit Bacon Bacon!

excerpts: But the breakfast bowl I had this morning is an embarrassment.
The eggs looked like they've been cooked in burnt butter or something.
the breakfast bowl.author: Elizabeth C.
the breakfast bowl.review: Giving 3-stars because I've tried other items on the menu I enjoyed.  But the breakfast bowl I had this morning is an embarrassment.  The eggs looked like they've been cooked in burnt butter or something.

excerpts: I had the breakfast bowl and the almost-vegetarian sandwich and both just lacked the overpowering bacon taste I desired.
Maybe it was just my first experience and maybe lunch is better but combined with their prices for the small portions I will probably try out other spots before returning.
the breakfast bowl.author: Kevin L.
the breakfast bowl.review: I love bacon which is what drew me here but their breakfast menu just didn't cut it for me the first time around. I had the breakfast bowl and the almost-vegetarian sandwich and both just lacked the overpowering bacon taste I desired. Maybe it was just my first experience and maybe lunch is better but combined with their prices for the small portions I will probably try out other spots before returning.

excerpts: The Almost Veggie Sandwich - One of the few menu items with vegetables.
It was great how they packed everything in to this sandwich, and it somehow all stayed put.
I asked for the scrambled eggs instead of over easy, so it wouldn't get all oozy and messy.

Some people may prefer the liquid richness of the runny egg yolk though. 
::
Breakfast Sandwich -
The brioche bun was SO FLUFFY!

They've really perfected this baby. 
::
Porky Fries - The bacon bits were quite the salty bunch.
They were almost like porchetta.
the almost veggie.author: Audrey L.
the almost veggie.review:
This little restaurant has a theme that they passionately stick to. Bacon everything.  

:: The Almost Veggie Sandwich - One of the few menu items with vegetables. It was great how they packed everything in to this sandwich, and it somehow all stayed put. I asked for the scrambled eggs instead of over easy, so it wouldn't get all oozy and messy. Some people may prefer the liquid richness of the runny egg yolk though. 
:: Breakfast Sandwich - The brioche bun was SO FLUFFY! They've really perfected this baby. 
:: Porky Fries - The bacon bits were quite the salty bunch. They were almost like porchetta. A total splurge, but it was a fun one.

Great place to stop in for a quick bite or even a brunch when you don't feel like waiting in a long line.

excerpts: I got the Almost Veggie Sandwich
but it was pretty oily
and I felt it lacked flavor but the broccoli (an odd choice for a sandwich) made it all taste weird when I added the hot sauce.
I ended up just picking out the broccoli first
and then it tasted better.
The egg was super runny which I love
and I probably looked like a savage eating that sandwich
the almost veggie.author: Jingxi Z.
the almost veggie.review:
Bacon bacon!! Love the name and they make a solid breakfast burrito (breakfast served all day) but sadly this place is just a-ok for me.

I got the Almost Veggie Sandwich but it was pretty oily and I felt it lacked flavor but the broccoli (an odd choice for a sandwich) made it all taste weird when I added the hot sauce. I ended up just picking out the broccoli first and then it tasted better. The egg was super runny which I love and I probably looked like a savage eating that sandwich but hey, I was hungry!

Next time will be back to try something else on their menu with some of their fries (porky fries anyone?!)!

excerpts: Had the almost veggie and added avocado, YUM!
Also had the chai iced tea, soy milk, also yum!
I am looking forward to bringing my boyfriend, he works for Yelp and he LOVES bacon haha
the almost veggie.author: Mary W.
the almost veggie.review:
Great little eating place. Went for a business meet up, just 2 of us. And it had perfect room to sit. Didn't get to crazy busy! Lots of food choices! Had the almost veggie and added avocado, YUM! Also had the chai iced tea, soy milk, also yum! 
I am looking forward to bringing my boyfriend, he works for Yelp and he LOVES bacon haha

excerpts: When I walked in with a bacon loving boyfriend, I was hopeful that I too could have a warm kitchen item like his breakfast sandwich, and asked if the almost veggie sandwich could be made vegetarian.
The guy behind the counter said yes,
so that's what I ordered.
But it's not what I got.
To be perfectly clear, It would have been just fine if he'd said "no, we don't do substitutions" or
"no, we won't do that".
I'd have gotten coffee and a pastry and no harm done.
Instead, I got a standard bacon sandwich.
The server returned to the counter, had someone from the kitchen pull the bacon off, and brought it back.
So I got a really greasy looking sandwich that had been piled in bacon a minute ago, which is gross and definitely not vegetarian.
I wouldn't have minded waiting for them to make a sandwich that wasn't covered in bacon grease.
But at this point, I didn't trust them to do that, so we just left when the boyfriend finished his sandwich.
We wasted $10 on a sandwich I didn't eat.
the almost veggie.author: Brigitte B.
the almost veggie.review:
I honestly can't tell wether these guys don't understand "vegetarian" or if they're just trying to piss people off to stay cool.  
TL;DR: Don't ask for substitutions, they're not really okay with it and won't actually do it - but they're not willing to tell you that to your face either. 

When I walked in with a bacon loving boyfriend, I was hopeful that I too could have a warm kitchen item like his breakfast sandwich, and asked if the almost veggie sandwich could be made vegetarian. The guy behind the counter said yes, so that's what I ordered. But it's not what I got.  
To be perfectly clear, It would have been just fine if he'd said "no, we don't do substitutions" or "no, we won't do that". I'd have gotten coffee and a pastry and no harm done.  
Instead, I got a standard bacon sandwich. The server returned to the counter, had someone from the kitchen pull the bacon off, and brought it back. So I got a really greasy looking sandwich that had been piled in bacon a minute ago, which is gross and definitely not vegetarian.
I wouldn't have minded waiting for them to make a sandwich that wasn't covered in bacon grease. But at this point, I didn't trust them to do that, so we just left when the boyfriend finished his sandwich. We wasted $10 on a sandwich I didn't eat.

excerpts: The Almost Veggie Sandwich is a mixture of always perfectly fresh bread, sautéed veggies, a fried egg (slightly runny) and, of course, bacon.
the almost veggie.author: Andre M.
the almost veggie.review: Never disappoints. Consistently amazing every time. The Almost Veggie Sandwich is a mixture of always perfectly fresh bread, sautéed veggies, a fried egg (slightly runny) and, of course, bacon. Try the Bouquet for your fill of crispy bacon every time. Even excellent coffee and a sunny, relaxing atmosphere. Go out of you way for Bacon, Bacon!

excerpts: My husband loved the breakfast burrito & the almost veggie sandwich was to die for, especially on the toasted brioche.
We also picked up two chocolate chip bacon cookies on a whim-- delicious!
If we lived in the area we would definitely make this a (terrible) habit.
the almost veggie.author: Savannah K.
the almost veggie.review: Service was fantastic - super friendly! My husband loved the breakfast burrito & the almost veggie sandwich was to die for, especially on the toasted brioche. We also picked up two chocolate chip bacon cookies on a whim-- delicious! If we lived in the area we would definitely make this a (terrible) habit.

excerpts: Loved the almost veggie one (yes, it has bacon).
Others had the regular breakfast sandwich with bacon jam (think pulled pork BBQ) and the burger.
The 2-patty cheese burger with bacon and grilled onions was quite something.
Delicious.
the almost veggie.author: Margaret B.
the almost veggie.review: Likely the best breakfast sandwich in the history of the breakfast sandwich. Loved the almost veggie one (yes, it has bacon). Others had the regular breakfast sandwich with bacon jam (think pulled pork BBQ) and the burger. The 2-patty cheese burger with bacon and grilled onions was quite something. Delicious.

excerpts: I was torn between the classic breakfast burrito and the breakfast sandwich.
So I got both, because why not?!?
But I have to say the breakfast sandwich was to die for.
The bun is out of this world.
Then the bacon jam and gooey cheddar cheese and bacon and fried egg.
the classic breakfast burrito.author: SA M.
the classic breakfast burrito.review:
This place is goood! If you love bacon come give it a try. There's some fun things on the menu. I was torn between the classic breakfast burrito and the breakfast sandwich. So I got both, because why not?!? But I have to say the breakfast sandwich was to die for. The bun is out of this world. Then the bacon jam and gooey cheddar cheese and bacon and fried egg. YUMMMM

DONT get me wrong, the breakfast burrito was good. But it was exactly as ordered a classic breakfast burrito. It was good. There's just something about that bacon jam and that bun on the sandwich. 

Oh and I got a Vietnamese iced coffee because I've been up since 4 AM, and I need a mid day/morning pick me up. 

There's a cute little mechanical pig you can ride. There's sweatshirts, hats and T-shirt's you can buy. And my food came out within 5 minutes. I highly recommend it!!!!

excerpts: I got the classic breakfast burrito which was really quite good.
Not the best breakfast
burrito
I've ever had
but they did a good job of having simple flavors that each came out
the classic breakfast burrito.author: Sarah C.
the classic breakfast burrito.review:
I'm feeling a little boarder line about the 4 stars - mostly I just don't feel like I know enough to appropriately rate it, but from the look of the menu  it seems like I would go with 4 if I knew it better.  

I got the classic breakfast burrito which was really quite good. Not the best breakfast burrito I've ever had but they did a good job of having simple flavors that each came out - I could taste the bacon, egg, and avocado clearly.

My husband got the Breakfast Burrito - which really just tasted like meat - so not as well balanced. Both were good sized - we came out full.

Good light in the space. Counter service. Very few people there when we went in, so it was quick, but might be different if it were busy. 

But don't go here if you don't like bacon - it's on pretty much everything, and is the point of going.

excerpts: The classic breakfast burrito was a little bland and had very little avocado.
Would recommend if you're nearby
but I wouldn't go out of my way to get it
the classic breakfast burrito.author: Bito M.
the classic breakfast burrito.review: The jam on the breakfast sandwich was the highlight. The egg was runny and the bread was fluffy. Wait time wasn't too long, but went on a Sunday morning and couldn't find seating. 8 dollars is a good price for a breakfast sandwich but it wasn't as filling as I would have hoped. The classic breakfast burrito was a little bland and had very little avocado. Would recommend if you're nearby but I wouldn't go out of my way to get it

excerpts: I ordered the Cobb salad via Postmates, and it was delicious.
Pork belly, pork shoulder, bacon, guac and a good Cobb dressing.
the cobb salad.author: Scott M.
the cobb salad.review: I ordered the Cobb salad via Postmates, and it was delicious. Pork belly, pork shoulder, bacon, guac and a good Cobb dressing.

excerpts: I regret ordering the Cobb Salad...should have gone for that breakfast
burrito everyone raves about.
My husband enjoyed his double cheese burger.
the cobb salad.author: ann s.
the cobb salad.review: I regret ordering the Cobb Salad...should have gone for that breakfast burrito everyone raves about. My husband enjoyed his double cheese burger. The fries were perfect. My son liked the grilled cheese with Bacon. Order your to go. Restrooms are behind the counter through the double doors upstairs to the left. I'll be back to order something better. Efficient service. Clean. Worth a shot as well as a return...oh grab the lemonade.

excerpts: You are delicious, I got the cobb salad which has bacon and pork belly in it, and oh man I'm in love with my taste buds right now.
This place is excellent, great service, and next time I'm trying those PORKY FRIES!
the cobb salad.author: Lauren V.
the cobb salad.review: how in heck did I just find you? You are delicious, I got the cobb salad which has bacon and pork belly in it, and oh man I'm in love with my taste buds right now. This place is excellent, great service, and next time I'm trying those PORKY FRIES!

excerpts: The bacon fried chicken sandwich comes w/ bacon strips and bacon mayo, both of which were well-proportioned to the rest of the sando.
Next time I'm in town
I'm definitely gonna go back to keep eating my way through their menu!
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.author: Julien I.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.review: This place is a great spot for rich and savory breakfast/lunch eats! The menu is obviously bacon-themed, but the vibe is more cool hole-in-the-wall diner than classic BBQ joint. The bacon fried chicken sandwich comes w/ bacon strips and bacon mayo, both of which were well-proportioned to the rest of the sando. Next time I'm in town I'm definitely gonna go back to keep eating my way through their menu!

excerpts: I had the bacon fried chicken sandwich and the porky fries.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.author: Susana T.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.review:
The truck came to SFSU and wasn't prepared to serve. A group of 5 people had waited for about 15-20 minutes for the truck to start taking orders. When one of the girls asked how long it'd be before they're ready, they said some amount of time and the group started walking away. The moment they stepped away, the truck started taking orders. They were pissed (I would've been too. That was messed up!) but I was glad I didn't have to wait for them to order either. 

I had the bacon fried chicken sandwich and the porky fries. The sandwich was ok but the fries were disappointing. The fries tasted like they were frozen at some point. They weren't crispy, nor were they soggy. They were in that weird in between when fries aren't fresh and so they had the texture of cardboard. Not worth it. Would I go back? Only if I had no other options.

excerpts: Gonna try the bacon fried chicken sandwich next time.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.author: Debbie T.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.review:
What a sandwich! The BBQ pork on a brioche bun was outstanding. Enjoyed the tangy bbq sauce.

The Cuban on a ciabatta roll was good but a little on the salty side. I enjoyed the spicy heat, though.

Gonna try the bacon fried chicken sandwich next time. Don't think I can try the fries.  The sandwiches are generous in size. No dinner for me, tonight!

Very friendly staff.

excerpts: I always get the Bacon fried Chicken sandwich!
It's a must try!
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.author: Antonio C.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.review: Love coming here every time they send me to work out in the area! I always get the Bacon fried Chicken sandwich! It's a must try!

excerpts: We had the grilled cheese, the bacon fried chicken sandwich and porky fries...
Delicious!
We left in a BaComa, another new word.
I love bacon bacon!
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.author: Kristy W.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.review: We came, we ate and we BaConquered! Yup, not a word but I made it up... If you love bacon, do yourself a favor and stop into this awesome spot. We had the grilled cheese, the bacon fried chicken sandwich and porky fries... Delicious! We left in a BaComa, another new word. I love bacon bacon!

excerpts: But the real treat, in my opinion, is the bacon fried chicken sandwich.
It is truly god inspired.
It was a gift from Jesus, Moses and Allah--they all got together a couple of years ago and collaborated on their finest creation.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.author: Evan M.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.review:
Good god, this food is incredible.

I live right across the street from this fine, fine institution. If I wasn't able to restrain myself I would probably be there every single day, resulting in heart disease or coronary artery issues.

The breakfast sandwiches are among the best I've had. Perfect egg, bacon, cheese, bacon jam... Mmmmmmm! But the real treat, in my opinion, is the bacon fried chicken sandwich. It is truly god inspired. It was a gift from Jesus, Moses and Allah--they all got together a couple of years ago and collaborated on their finest creation. This sandwich is LIVING PROOF that not only does god exist, but he wants us to enjoy delicious bacon (even Allah).

There you have it. Read no further, because the rest of these reviews are irrelevant now that you know this place is top-tier.

excerpts: But the real treat, in my opinion, is the bacon fried chicken sandwich.
Bacon Bacon is a local treasure and just a gem.
Delicious food, nice folks, great sense of humor.
Stop by their storefront if you're in the area - yummy sandwiches, great bacon, everything I have tried so far has been wonderful!
Bring by your friends and family, I'm sure they'll love it!!
Don't take my word for it, just have a look at their other reviews and you'll see that this small  restaurant is a gem.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.author: Alicia R.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.review: Favorite spot in the neighborhood. I get my morning coffee here and order greasy breakfast food for my weekend hangovers. The porky fries, breakfast burrito and the daily special, which is a cuban sandwich, are delicious! But the real treat, in my opinion, is the bacon fried chicken sandwich. Bacon Bacon is a local treasure and just a gem.  Delicious food, nice folks, great sense of humor. Stop by their storefront if you're in the area - yummy sandwiches, great bacon, everything I have tried so far has been wonderful! Bring by your friends and family, I'm sure they'll love it!! Don't take my word for it, just have a look at their other reviews and you'll see that this small  restaurant is a gem.

excerpts: We ordered the Bacon fried chicken sandwich + porky fries + chocolate  covered  bacon....
it was simply awesome!!!!
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.author: Alex ..
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.review: We had some great eats here during the S.F. Beer Festival.  We ordered the Bacon fried chicken sandwich + porky fries + chocolate  covered  bacon....it was simply awesome!!!!

excerpts: As a bacon lover I had high expectations but unfortunately during this visit the bacon fried chicken sandwich was overcooked and the fries were hard and bland.
A disappointing experience in this instance
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.author: Ray H.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.review: As a bacon lover I had high expectations but unfortunately during this visit the bacon fried chicken sandwich was overcooked and the fries were hard and bland. A disappointing experience in this instance

excerpts: Try the Bacon Fried Chicken Sandwich!
Great service too and definitely ride the piggie
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.author: Melissa A.
the bacon fried chicken sandwich.review: Bacon Bacon was all I expected! Try the Bacon Fried Chicken Sandwich! Great service too and definitely ride the piggie

excerpts: The bacon grilled cheese was also worth the trip.
I love how many of their dishes incorporate pork belly or pulled pork as well as bacon.
ALL THE PORK.
the bacon grilled cheese.author: Ryan S.
the bacon grilled cheese.review:
Solid place!  When -every- dish (well almost) has bacon, what's not to love?

Nestled in a nice area on the edge of Haight-Ashbury, Bacon Bacon is just a fun place to be. The menu is very broad, and I was torn between several things. Cheaper than I expected, though portions were not especially large. Expect to order a few things if you're hungry. Atmosphere was nice, and you can eat with a great view of a neighborhood you probably can't afford ;)

I definitely recommend the breakfast bacon taco and the BBQ burrito. Both were amazing and quickly quelled my hunger. The bacon grilled cheese was also worth the trip. I love how many of their dishes incorporate pork belly or pulled pork as well as bacon. ALL THE PORK. Coffee wasn't bad either.

Can't wait to return for another weekend craving!

excerpts: we ordered the Cuban, the Bahn Mi, and the Bacon Grilled Cheese, which all came in a fairly large serving, so we were all fine sharing.
While putting bacon in a Bahn Mi and bacon "jam" in a grilled cheese may sound unusual, it made our dishes surprisingly much more savory and added that salt component without being too overwhelming.
the bacon grilled cheese.author: Kyrie S.
the bacon grilled cheese.review:
Bacon? Bacon.

There's a reason they say bacon twice in their name, because they take this delicacy veryyy seriously. Everything on their menu is chock-full of bacon! From the salads, to the wide array of their sandwiches, to even their desserts and drinks (my friend ordered the Mexican Hot Chocolate which was topped with bacon, a fun and delicious treat!)! 

The place is rather tight, but what they lack in size, they make up for in the close care and attention they have for their customers and food. The service was very kind and helpful, and our food came out at a very fast time! 

Now onto the bacon. we ordered the Cuban, the Bahn Mi, and the Bacon Grilled Cheese, which all came in a fairly large serving, so we were all fine sharing. While putting bacon in a Bahn Mi and bacon "jam" in a grilled cheese may sound unusual, it made our dishes surprisingly much more savory and added that salt component without being too overwhelming. There is so much precision to crafting all these dishes with bacon as to not be excessively greasy, salty, or fatty, and the people here have perfected their recipes so much, it makes me want to come back and try everything, especially their desserts!

While seating may be sparce, the atmosphere is very fun as there are photographs of satisfied customers all on the walls, and we (and you!) will be glad to be on it as well.

excerpts: The wife had the bacon grilled cheese.
Coffee was so good that we had to get some more for the road back home.
We will def be making this a regular visit on our next SF road trip.
the bacon grilled cheese.author: Manny F.
the bacon grilled cheese.review: Amazing find on our way out of SF! The entire family loved it. Highly recommend the breakfast burrito that is very different that would you would expect. The wife had the bacon grilled cheese. Coffee was so good that we had to get some more for the road back home. We will def be making this a regular visit on our next SF road trip.

excerpts: The bacon grilled cheese sandwich is also very good: the Texas toast are treated immaculately with bacon jam (definitely beats the fruity stuff any day!) and the melted cheddar cheese with the bacon is perfect for a simple but delicious treat.
I'm not sure that I would pay $8.50 for it though, but I was craving grilled cheese and tomato soup today, so this definitely hit the spot!
the bacon grilled cheese.author: Vickie W.
the bacon grilled cheese.review:
I've been to the Bacon Bacon food trucks a few times and it has been consistently yummy! You can expect, of course, lots of bacon, and filling comfort foods. The sizes are a bit small for the price but the portions are definitely filling. 

I enjoyed the California Bacon BBQ Burrito, which was packed with pulled BBQ pork, bacon, french fries, and crispy belly. Though there is a LOT (and I do mean a lot) of meat, it doesn't taste too greasy, and at $9.50 (without tax), you are getting a lot of meat (although the burrito is considerably smaller than other ones of the same cost in the Mission district). The bacon grilled cheese sandwich is also very good: the Texas toast are treated immaculately with bacon jam (definitely beats the fruity stuff any day!) and the melted cheddar cheese with the bacon is perfect for a simple but delicious treat. I'm not sure that I would pay $8.50 for it though, but I was craving grilled cheese and tomato soup today, so this definitely hit the spot!

excerpts: Get the bacon grilled cheese!
It's so good!
Don't do it with a sweet drink because that's just too much for your stomach.
the bacon grilled cheese.author: Moriah P.
the bacon grilled cheese.review: Get the bacon grilled cheese! It's so good! Don't do it with a sweet drink because that's just too much for your stomach. My friend tried the breakfast sandwich with hot chocolate and it didn't do her stomach well. Which is why I ordered a lemonade.

excerpts: However, I will say that the bacon grilled cheese and the bacon jam were FABULOUS.
So maybe get those to be on the safe and still really amazing side.
I will definitely go back just for that grilled cheese.
the bacon grilled cheese.author: Melanie M.
the bacon grilled cheese.review: I REALLY wanted to like this place because I LOVE bacon but unfortunately had a sad experience. I don't remember the name of the sandwich that I got but it was basically fried chicken wrapped in bacon, sounds amazing right? Well unfortunately the way they cooked it, the underside of the bacon was completely uncooked... whhiicch kind of made me nauseous. *sigh* However, I will say that the bacon grilled cheese and the bacon jam were FABULOUS. So maybe get those to be on the safe and still really amazing side. I will definitely go back just for that grilled cheese.

excerpts: I ordered the banh mi, while others in my party ordered the breakfast sandwich, cobb salad, bacon cheeseburger, and the cuban.
the cuban.author: Nina V.
the cuban.review:
I came here with family for a quick meal before exploring the city. The restaurant is quite small, with about 4 bar-height tables and a longer counter that can all seat about 20 people.

I ordered the banh mi, while others in my party ordered the breakfast sandwich, cobb salad, bacon cheeseburger, and the cuban.

As we sat down, we all noticed the crazy amount of flies around our table. After a few seconds of looking around the restaurant, we noticed there were flies EVERYWHERE. They're all over the walls, merchandise (sweater, mugs, etc.) that they sell, napkins, cups, water cooler, everywhere. This made me lose my appetite really quickly.

While my Banh Mi sandwich was good, I couldn't get over all of the flies. Additionally, the bacon was really overcooked - not crispy but rather really hard and inedible.

There are restrooms, but you literally have to go through the kitchen and up some stairs across an extremely greasy floor.

Overall, I'd say the food is good, but the restaurant really needs to put some effort into cleaning the place. I understand that cooking bacon all day and having grease spatter everywhere doesn't help, but I would think it's health hazard to have grease on the floors and allowing flies to breed here. Gross.

excerpts: The Cuban was to die for the meat was tender and felt like it was cooked for 8 hours plus.
the cuban.author: Christopher S.
the cuban.review:
Order: Cuban sandwich and Mac and cheese balls 

The mac and cheese balls were a little salty dipped in the sauce. Not over powering but when I took a bite my partner and I both said it without thinking. 

The Cuban was to die for the meat was tender and felt like it was cooked for 8 hours plus. The bread was nice and toasted the bell peppers were a nice twist 

This place is a nice spot to drop by for a bite on your way to somewhere. 
Sitting is nice also.

excerpts: I got the Cuban and there was a decent amount of meat on there
but it was super dry.
The meat was good though.
the cuban.author: Mal L.
the cuban.review:
This place is overhyped, super bummed it wasn't as good as what I dreamed about. I've been to both locations. The one in Haight I got the Cuban and there was a decent amount of meat on there but it was super dry. The meat was good though. My husband got the Bird and he had the same problem, not enough sauce. 

When the King St. location was open I had the Breakfast Burrito and that was good. It was super heavy and I felt like my heart was going to stop after I was done. It wasn't anything outstanding, just a typical breakfast burrito. 

There is no parking ... so good luck. Pricing is average.

If this was the only place to eat in the area I'd go here again but it's not a spot I crave or keep wanting to go back too.

excerpts: yes that's the Cuban
and it was wonderful.
the cuban.author: Victoria E.
the cuban.review:
"We finally made it." When we arrived on foot, he turned to me and said it slowly. He looked impressed, as if he did not believe that we'd ever make it out here. I remembered distinctively that day when I sent an online review of this place to him, and said, "you should go there." He replied back "Yes plz" but he never came here on his own even though this was damn close to his house. He was waiting for me to go with, as it turned out. 

But you see, I had seen their food truck in SoMa, I never paid much attention to it really, until a nice article about the store front showed up. I go where the reviews tell me to go. I'm a follower and not a leader. And I like to stereotype.  You know how some people stereotype Asians, I stereotype the Midwesterners. If you announce to me that you are from Nebraska, Indiana and Iowa, I immediately think you are raised on a farm, harvested corn and ate bacon until you can't stand it any more and then you headed west. I'd be wrong, of course, but I'd be right about him liking bacon, who is one of those (wrongly) stereotyped Midwesterners.

I knew because we had spent weeks last winter discussing bacon. Yes I like to spend time pontificating bacon. 

The restaurant is hidden among a bunch of stately Victorian homes, "stately" maybe an overstatement, it's pretty and pristine, and well maintained. Fredrick street is residential, except for Bacon Bacon, there were just bunch of Victorians. You'd think you'd smell the bacon from miles away but you'd be wrong. The store front is not very large. I missed it, he spotted it. Once inside, you'd feel that it's got a bit of an odd combo: They also serve espresso drinks, fanciful ones with their own blend of coffee beans, along side with down home cooking of bacon themed sandwiches.

For $7, you get a gourmet breakfast sandwich with googy eggs and bacon strips. For a little more, $9, you get the stack of meats piled on with bacon as one of the meats, inside of a fresh roll, yes that's the Cuban and it was wonderful. If you are into pork belly alongside of your thick cut strips of bacon.

Americano for the after this-piggie-went-to-the-market meal drink. Foamed just right.

Inside dining spots are very sparse, but, on a weekend holiday, one could withstand a little bit of a wait and your patience will be rewarded with the front window counter space, where you get the view of the pretty Victorian homes across the street. Turning the other way, you'd often see someone riding the electric pig doing the photo op thing. Earlier, I had mistaken it for the horsey until he asked me to get on top of it like every other tourist. No, thank you, I look ridiculous enough without hopping on that piggy. 

I don't think I've ever had a sandwich that tasted this good. 

"It's worth the wait." He concluded. 

Is it? Must all good things in life withstand the agony of wait? Now it's been found, can we declare every day be bacon bacon day from here on out?

While putting bacon in a Bahn Mi and bacon "jam" in a grilled cheese may sound unusual, it made our dishes surprisingly much more savory and added that salt component without being too overwhelming.
