excerpts: Got the Cuban as well.
the cuban.author: Jeffrey O.
the cuban.review:
Bacon fried chicken sandwich is ridiculous..... Love it!!! Great mix of salty and savory. 

Got the Cuban as well. Decent, but not amazing. 

The homemade pork rinds were grub #100%

excerpts: The Cuban tasted like pulled pork with melted cheese and bland roasted red peppers.
the cuban.author: Betty V.
the cuban.review:
After reading reviews, looking at photos, researching thoroughly, we made the trek to Cole Valley. This seemed like a bacon lover's dream come true, but now that I've been here , I don't need to return and here's why...

1. This place is tiny with very little seating. Read that as noisy, cramped and super annoying when you're sitting next to the mechanical horse thing with screeching children a foot away giggling gleefully ,so you feel like an asshole if you say anything. 
2. It took forever, ok the figurative forever, about 25 minutes, to get 3 sandwiches. That's an average of 8 minutes per sandwich! Understaffed? 
3. It ain't cheap. With all the extra money you're making, how about hiring more staff. See point #2. 
4. Most importantly, it's called Bacon Bacon you'd think they would use quality bacon. Come on!! Instead the bacon was thin, flavorless, barely there and tasted like the cheap Kirkland (aka Costco) brand. Sad face. If they had used Applewood smoked bacon, you'd be able to taste it. Instead everything tasted like pulled pork. if you add hot sauce, you'll definitely not taste bacon and you'll have to change the name of the sandwich cause now it's just misleading. 

The Cuban tasted like pulled pork with melted cheese and bland roasted red peppers. 
The breakfast burrito tasted like pulled pork with melted cheese and squishy baby food consistency avocado. It was so "wet" and greasy, the smell stuck to me for hours. 
The bacon chicken burger had the thinnest slice of really crunchy overly deep fried Panko crusted chicken breast known to man and by now you could probably guess...the bacon was not noticeable and bland bland bland. 

Echoing what another reviewer said, due to blandness, condiments have to be added. Bbq sauce would make more sense as something available to use. 

All these people who gave this place 5 stars are either friends of the proprietors, getting kick backs or living under a rock so anything would taste amazeballs. I was massively disappointed.

excerpts: My friend and I tried the grilled chicken sandwich, the cuban sandwich, and the Mexican hot chocolate - all were delicious!
the cuban.author: Corinne K.
the cuban.review: Discovered this place through an episode of chopped where the owner was competing and knew right away I needed to try it! Was not disappointed at all! My friend and I tried the grilled chicken sandwich, the cuban sandwich, and the Mexican hot chocolate - all were delicious!

excerpts: D got the Cuban which he really enjoyed.
the cuban.author: Autumn Y.
the cuban.review:
Just OK. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back. 

Food: pretty good. I got the burger. They asked how I wanted it done and I said medium, it came out well done. It wasn't the worst but it too dry for me to really love it. D got the Cuban which he really enjoyed. We shared the porky fries which were good but missing salt. If you've been to Lardo in PDX, they're similar but not as tasty. 

Service: eh. The guy that took our order was great. He was friendly, efficient and pleasant. There was also a girl working the counter and her attitude made me so uncomfortable that I tried to avoid all interaction. When I asked for a side of mayo for my overdone burger, she looked at me like 'how dare you ask me for anything?!'. Yeah- NOPE.

excerpts: The Cuban on a ciabatta roll was good but a little on the salty side.
the cuban.author: Debbie T.
the cuban.review:
What a sandwich! The BBQ pork on a brioche bun was outstanding. Enjoyed the tangy bbq sauce.

The Cuban on a ciabatta roll was good but a little on the salty side. I enjoyed the spicy heat, though.

Gonna try the bacon fried chicken sandwich next time. Don't think I can try the fries.  The sandwiches are generous in size. No dinner for me, tonight!

Very friendly staff.

excerpts:
The Cuban - No longer on the menu
Grilled Cheese
the cuban.author: Bethany S.
the cuban.review:
THIS PLACE! UGH This place! (I mean this in the most loving voice ever)

I lived just a block away from Bacon Bacon so I was here every day for my morning coffee and when I was feeling fancy, a maple bacon scone. I became friends with all of the staff as they are all very wonderful.

List of my favorite items Bacon Bacon has to offer in no particular order:
Drip Coffee
Vietnamese Iced Coffee
Maple Bacon Scone
Parfait
Breakfast Sandwich
French Fries, both regular and Porky
Breakfast Burrito
Burger
Bahn Mi
The Cuban - No longer on the menu
Grilled Cheese

I do regret not being able to say goodbye as I suddenly moved to Orange County. I miss the people and I miss the food here. Next time I visit SF, I will definitely come by and say hi. I hope you guys don't miss us too much!

excerpts: The cuban sandwich was really good, great cuts of meat and the bread was freshly made and soft.
Overall really happy with my experience here, would highly recommend it!
the cuban.author: Josue V.
the cuban.review: Amazing food! Came here for a Sunday brunch and was very impressed with the food quality and taste. The restaurant is pretty small but luckily my gf and I were able to find seats quickly. I ordered the porky fries and the daily special which was a cuban sandwich and boy were both great. Porky fries were covered in pork and cheese, very good amount of fries as well. The cuban sandwich was really good, great cuts of meat and the bread was freshly made and soft. Overall really happy with my experience here, would highly recommend it!

excerpts: The California Bacon BBQ Burrito and The Cuban - both were very good!
the cuban.author: Elizabeth S.
the cuban.review: Ordered (via Postmates) The California Bacon BBQ Burrito and The Cuban - both were very good! I was skeptical about The Chocolate Covered Bacon, but it was delicious!

excerpts: Though you have some well priced items I find it impossible not to have the Cuban every time, altho well worth the $10+ sandwych$
I think there are other items on the menu, I've split halves of other sandwiches when I can spare/share the Cuban.
Love the bacon fried chicken too.. but beyond that, me and my bf find it hard to venture further.
He's pretty stuck on the Cuban too.

It's not the absolute best sandwich in the world necessarily, as this town is not lacking spots, but the special Cuban flavorings+ extra crispy crunchy bits of fried belly with just the right amount of grease light  +perfect light dusting of salty +convenience of proximity...
ok
so I am absurdly rav right now, no bkfst yet, need to food shop and waiting impatiently for 11a lunch menu to start...
the cuban.author: Carmenchu C.
the cuban.review:
As it is seriously one of my deepest wish in life to Always have a Bacon Bacon as my neighbor no matter where I live and I worry sometimes because they're not ever crowded when I go, and they close early at 3p most days... Why?? Has the neighborhood with all the gatzillion companies and businesses and residential bldgs. And ballpark nearby- Still not discover you?? Maybe it's your very subdued subtle signage, I would miss you too if I was not a bacon bacon foodtruck planned to stalk bersearcher... I had just heard about ur food truck on 11th and had a scheduled attack plan but then found out, whuuth? New Bacon Bacon cafe opened 2blocks away??!! Only then did I really believe in destiny and karmic fate... or that maybe I really am one of the luckiest people alive as some have said. (Tho still not a full believer, definitely there r luckier peep esp. in sf.. but digressin..I'm ok lucky, grateful no matter, Love Life!) in any case, the Bacon is here and he is mine! 

The only taint on the pork train is that I can't go there everyday as its a bit on the spends side for me. Though you have some well priced items I find it impossible not to have the Cuban every time, altho well worth the $10+ sandwych$ but then the porky fries are necessary to the essential Cuban (u will understand why)then the bacon desserts, sometimes caramel, sometimes chocolate, a bacon flavor chain that u just let happen since u didn't wish to interrupt it anyway...

I think there are other items on the menu, I've split halves of other sandwiches when I can spare/share the Cuban. Love the bacon fried chicken too.. but beyond that, me and my bf find it hard to venture further. He's pretty stuck on the Cuban too. It's not the absolute best sandwich in the world necessarily, as this town is not lacking spots, but the special Cuban flavorings+ extra crispy crunchy bits of fried belly with just the right amount of grease light  +perfect light dusting of salty +convenience of proximity... ok so I am absurdly rav right now, no bkfst yet, need to food shop and waiting impatiently for 11a lunch menu to start...  but still I'm only exaggerating slightly.... for today as with most days, it is give me Cuban or give me death..

And peeps are super nice there too, they insisted on cooking a fresh batch of sandwiches when I was really late for a pickup order the other day.. rare... tho wouldn't blame them if they ate it;) i just truly hope biz has picked up as they should not ever close shop until we've agreed where to move together next! ps:not promoting pork eating as the piggies are damn cute and smart! Intellect of a 3yr human supposedly... so sorry, I will try to abstain.. i will try not to be a weak human....hmmm...uh oh..stomach grumble...

excerpts: My kids actually made nom-nom sounds while eating the Cuban sandwich, which was hot, oozing with cheese and pork juices and goodness.
the cuban.author: Nevada L.
the cuban.review: Fantastic from start to finish. My kids actually made nom-nom sounds while eating the Cuban sandwich, which was hot, oozing with cheese and pork juices and goodness.

excerpts: I ordered the banh mi, while others in my party ordered the breakfast sandwich, cobb salad, bacon cheeseburger, and the cuban.
the banh mi.author: Nina V.
the banh mi.review:
I came here with family for a quick meal before exploring the city. The restaurant is quite small, with about 4 bar-height tables and a longer counter that can all seat about 20 people.

I ordered the banh mi, while others in my party ordered the breakfast sandwich, cobb salad, bacon cheeseburger, and the cuban.

As we sat down, we all noticed the crazy amount of flies around our table. After a few seconds of looking around the restaurant, we noticed there were flies EVERYWHERE. They're all over the walls, merchandise (sweater, mugs, etc.) that they sell, napkins, cups, water cooler, everywhere. This made me lose my appetite really quickly.

While my Banh Mi sandwich was good, I couldn't get over all of the flies. Additionally, the bacon was really overcooked - not crispy but rather really hard and inedible.

There are restrooms, but you literally have to go through the kitchen and up some stairs across an extremely greasy floor.

Overall, I'd say the food is good, but the restaurant really needs to put some effort into cleaning the place. I understand that cooking bacon all day and having grease spatter everywhere doesn't help, but I would think it's health hazard to have grease on the floors and allowing flies to breed here. Gross.

excerpts: The Banh Mi sandwich recently returned to the menu at this location as well.
the banh mi.author: Erik H.
the banh mi.review:
There are lots of places that have caught on to the bacon craze, but there still is truth to going to a place that focuses on bacon to get the best of the best.

While the trucks still work as great advertisers to new people to the concept, this original location in the Haight still is my go to place although the owner, Jim, spends more time at his bigger 3rd street location.  

While the menu has changed over the years, many of the classics are still there like the breakfast sandwich and breakfast burrito.  The Banh Mi sandwich recently returned to the menu at this location as well.  

Many menu items have returned after the historic battle with anti-swine neighbors that resulted in a nice plug on SNL, but the casualty is the pork belly sandwich I figure just became too expensive.

This location gets packed in weekends while the other location is more for the working crowd so be prepared to grab a cup of coffee and wait.  Parking can be difficult as well, but it is all worth it right?

What did I have this time around?  We split the breakfast burrito and sandwich.  

Yes they will always have me at Bacon!!

excerpts: Hearing that the breakfast burritos "were to die for," my friends and I went for that and the Banh Mi.
the banh mi.author: Cindy N.
the banh mi.review:
This is a small spot my friends and I stopped by before heading to Golden Gate park. We came around 1pm on a Saturday and managed to snag the big table in the back, but I think that depends a lot on luck. Hearing that the breakfast burritos "were to die for," my friends and I went for that and the Banh Mi. 

After watching a number of customers behind us get their orders first (maybe because they were to-go? still unknown...), we finally (and slowly) got all our orders. The sizes of the portions are definitely overwhelming and filling, but I think that the breakfast burrito is average at best. I'm not usually a fan of bacon, but I was a bit disappointed to see that the bacon at a place known for bacon was not very impressive. 

Overall, the service was slow, the food was average, and it's a tight squeeze to find a place to sit. Would think about it before going here again.

excerpts: I enjoyed the California Bacon BBQ Burrito, which was packed with pulled BBQ pork, bacon, french fries, and crispy belly.

Though there is a LOT (and I do mean a lot) of meat, it doesn't taste too greasy, and at $9.50 (without tax), you are getting a lot of meat (although the burrito is considerably smaller than other ones of the same cost in the Mission district).
the california bacon bbq burrito.author: Vickie W.
the california bacon bbq burrito.review:
I've been to the Bacon Bacon food trucks a few times and it has been consistently yummy! You can expect, of course, lots of bacon, and filling comfort foods. The sizes are a bit small for the price but the portions are definitely filling. 

I enjoyed the California Bacon BBQ Burrito, which was packed with pulled BBQ pork, bacon, french fries, and crispy belly. Though there is a LOT (and I do mean a lot) of meat, it doesn't taste too greasy, and at $9.50 (without tax), you are getting a lot of meat (although the burrito is considerably smaller than other ones of the same cost in the Mission district). The bacon grilled cheese sandwich is also very good: the Texas toast are treated immaculately with bacon jam (definitely beats the fruity stuff any day!) and the melted cheddar cheese with the bacon is perfect for a simple but delicious treat. I'm not sure that I would pay $8.50 for it though, but I was craving grilled cheese and tomato soup today, so this definitely hit the spot!

excerpts: The California Bacon BBQ Burrito and The Cuban - both were very good!
the california bacon bbq burrito.author: Elizabeth S.
the california bacon bbq burrito.review: Ordered (via Postmates) The California Bacon BBQ Burrito and The Cuban - both were very good! I was skeptical about The Chocolate Covered Bacon, but it was delicious!

excerpts: I  had the grilled chicken sandwich.
the grilled chicken sandwich.author: Alicia H.
the grilled chicken sandwich.review: We ordered two burritos, filled with pulled pork, pork belly, coleslaw  and french fries. My sil had the fried chicken sandwich. He loved it. I  had the grilled chicken sandwich. I  would love to go back and try the porky fries. Fun atmosphere and excellent staff. Deliciousness

excerpts: My friend and I tried the grilled chicken sandwich, the cuban sandwich, and the Mexican hot chocolate - all were delicious!
the grilled chicken sandwich.author: Corinne K.
the grilled chicken sandwich.review: Discovered this place through an episode of chopped where the owner was competing and knew right away I needed to try it! Was not disappointed at all! My friend and I tried the grilled chicken sandwich, the cuban sandwich, and the Mexican hot chocolate - all were delicious!

excerpts: I order the LGBT (heh) sandwich, which consists of lettuce, goat cheese, bacon, and tomato.
the lgbt.author: Jes G.
the lgbt.review:
Stopped by here after a morning of hiking around Mt. Sutro.  It's a small little cafe space with lots of bacon on the menu.

I order the LGBT (heh) sandwich, which consists of lettuce, goat cheese, bacon, and tomato.  Also picked up a bag of chips, a lemonade, and a chocolate dipped chocolate chip cookie topped with chopped bacon.

Best idea I've ever had.  This had such a great combo of flavors, and, hello, it has bacon.  BACON THE EVERYTHING!

I know it's a fad/trend, but it certainly helps that it tastes so amazing.  Bacon has been a staple of great food for a while, and a bacon everything place may (or may not) be sustainable forever, but why not enjoy it while we can?!  Such a great way to spend your lunch!

excerpts: My husband ordered the LGBT.
Three out of the four devoured our sandwiches.
They were definitely outstanding.
My son, who's a picky eater, was sad that his sandwich came with a fried egg instead of scrambled (my bad, I know he doesn't like fried egg, but wasn't thinking when I ordered).
The super sweet and awesome guy working the counter noticed my son was unhappy and offered to make him another one with scrambled instead of fried.
How awesome was that??!!!
My son had such a huge smile on his face!
Outstanding customer service!
I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes breakfast foods and burgers.
the lgbt.author: Heidi M.
the lgbt.review: It was around lunch time and we were driving around San Francisco trying to figure out where to eat. A list of restaurants came up on our map, Bacon Bacon being one of them. Of course, the name immediately got our attention, so we had to come check it out. It did not disappoint. My son and I ordered the Breakfast Sandwich. My daughter ordered the Bacon, Swiss Croissant. My husband ordered the LGBT.  Three out of the four devoured our sandwiches. They were definitely outstanding. My son, who's a picky eater, was sad that his sandwich came with a fried egg instead of scrambled (my bad, I know he doesn't like fried egg, but wasn't thinking when I ordered). The super sweet and awesome guy working the counter noticed my son was unhappy and offered to make him another one with scrambled instead of fried. How awesome was that??!!!  My son had such a huge smile on his face!  Outstanding customer service!  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes breakfast foods and burgers.

excerpts:
I give you a Haiku about the LGBT sandwich:

Was that Safeway bread?
the lgbt.author: Russ S.
the lgbt.review:
I give you a Haiku about the LGBT sandwich:

Was that Safeway bread? 
There was not enough bacon. 
I had such high hopes.

excerpts: The LGBT (their version of BLT) is my fave.
the lgbt.author: Jessica K.
the lgbt.review:
I am in love with this place!!!!

Coffee is great; smokey with an almost chocolatey rich flavor. One of the only coffees I've had that I can drink without any kind of sweetener in it. 

Their maple bacon scones are probably the best breakfast pastry I've ever had. They are nice and dry, as a good scone should be, with just a hint of sweet icing. They top it off with little pieces of candied bacon... It's heaven. Perfect with coffee. There was a time were my fiancé and I literally had them for breakfast 5 times in one week. It was becoming a problem lol. 

All of their sandwiches are great, the bread they use is so fresh and delicious and soft. The LGBT (their version of BLT) is my fave. 

As far as the actual bacon they use in their dishes, it's cooked just the way I like it. Crispy, but not TOO crispy; you can still feel the chewiness of the fat and meat content. 

Only problem I have is that it's expensive for what it is.... But people pay a lot of money for their addictions, so I guess they are just being smart about it.

excerpts: The LGBT was super bland.
I added a fried egg for only $1 which was nice and to my surprise it had a runny yolk because I forgot to mention over medium.
You should make note though cause not everybody likes that.
I winded up salting the drippy egg and dipping my sandwich in it with utter disappointment.
I did not count the slices of back  like another yelper
did
but it seemed like enough.
The tomatoes were not ripe and there was not a whole lot of goat cheese.
The lettuce was plentiful and fresh and the roll was crispy and perfect.
It was just like dry, needed more goo.
Like mayo first and then goat cheese.
Or shoot maybe a mayo spread already mixed.
The bacon itself was not hardly salty and I am now thinking that was the problem.
I didn't even hesitate when I saw the name  Bacon Bacon.
I thought everything would be amazing.
I would try it again but highly unlikely that I would be around there.
I should have done the sandwich with the jam.
Surprisingly disappointed.
the lgbt.author: Rene V.
the lgbt.review:
I am saddened about this review.
The LGBT was super bland. I added a fried egg for only $1 which was nice and to my surprise it had a runny yolk because I forgot to mention over medium. You should make note though cause not everybody likes that.  I winded up salting the drippy egg and dipping my sandwich in it with utter disappointment. 
I did not count the slices of back  like another yelper  did but it seemed like enough. The tomatoes were not ripe and there was not a whole lot of goat cheese. The lettuce was plentiful and fresh and the roll was crispy and perfect. It was just like dry, needed more goo. Like mayo first and then goat cheese. Or shoot maybe a mayo spread already mixed. The bacon itself was not hardly salty and I am now thinking that was the problem.
I didn't even hesitate when I saw the name  Bacon Bacon. I thought everything would be amazing. I would try it again but highly unlikely that I would be around there. I should have done the sandwich with the jam.
Surprisingly disappointed. :(

excerpts: It was a new experience for all of us, so we ordered 2 types of sandwiches:  Burgers and the LGBT.
The pics of the burger were very enticing....the LGBT description stated that each sandwich would have 5 slices of bacon.
Each of the LGBT's had a maximum of 3 slices of bacon...
the lgbt.author: Rodney B.
the lgbt.review:
Did not meet expectations.  Bacon Bacon has been on my radar for some time...it was tough to chase down truck locations...it became my "great white whale" for over a year!  But when a friend told me they opened a store in the Haight (not far from the office), I jumped at the chance to finally try it out...and so did my fellow co-workers.  It was a new experience for all of us, so we ordered 2 types of sandwiches:  Burgers and the LGBT.  The pics of the burger were very enticing....the LGBT description stated that each sandwich would have 5 slices of bacon.  

When we got our food...man, the overwhelming consensus was disappointment.  The burgers and LGBT's we're plain tasting and the breads used were Grocery Outlet quality.  Each of the LGBT's had a maximum of 3 slices of bacon...WTH???

I will not be returning anytime soon....what a let down!

excerpts: We were less excited by the LGBT (BLT with goat cheese) and Bacon Grilled Cheese that we shared, but want to go back to try the Bacon Burger and another flight of bacon.
This was the first time that I ever saw my boyfriend so satiated with bacon that he was unable to finish it.
I was sad to hear that their food truck burned, but I look forward to visiting that once they get a new one running.
the lgbt.author: Kris B.
the lgbt.review:
I brought my bacon-bewitched boyfriend to Bacon Bacon for his birthday brunch and it was beyond belief! Our best bite? The Bacon Bouquet! This was a flight of each of their bacon preparations including: chimichurri, bbq, breaded & deep fried, and candy (brown sugar bacon). We were less excited by the LGBT (BLT with goat cheese) and Bacon Grilled Cheese that we shared, but want to go back to try the Bacon Burger and another flight of bacon. This was the first time that I ever saw my boyfriend so satiated with bacon that he was unable to finish it. 
I was sad to hear that their food truck burned, but I look forward to visiting that once they get a new one running.

excerpts: I ordered the LGBT and was not too pleased with the result,  it was lacking in the  bacon department.
Thank bacon
my bf ordered "the bird" and it was so delicious we will definitely be going back to try more items.
the lgbt.author: Monique H.
the lgbt.review: I ordered the LGBT and was not too pleased with the result,  it was lacking in the  bacon department. Thank bacon  my bf ordered "the bird" and it was so delicious we will definitely be going back to try more items.

excerpts: The fries were good, but suffered from the transport time as they were soggy.
Still good flavor.
the fries.author: Elena N.
the fries.review:
So I decided to get two burritos for lunch. Some of my coworkers thought I was being ridiculous, but I didn't care. (Apparently two burritos is too much?) I went ahead and did it anyways. Our office lunch delivery arrived by Caviar on Friday, April 20th around 12:30pm.

*Bacon Fries: French fries tossed in herbs, parmesan, spicy olive oil, homemade bacon bits, and bacon jam served with a side of blue cheese vinaigrette ($7.50)
*Breakfast Burrito: Scrambled egg, pork shoulder, bacon, avocado, and cheddar ($8.50)

I got the breakfast burrito, but also tried some of my coworker's bacon fries. Both items were chock full of bacon and meat. The burrito was stuffed with filling which I appreciated. Not sure if they offer hot sauces at the location, but this was great with some heat. (I always have multiple hot sauces at my desk.) The fries were good, but suffered from the transport time as they were soggy. Still good flavor. Though they didn't deliver the blue cheese vinaigrette, so I was missing that cheesy element.

Great breakfast burrito. If they were close to work, I'd get it more often. Maybe the next time Bacon Bacon rolls around as an office lunch option.

excerpts: Anyways, I will be back to try the fries, the mac and cheese balls, and the chicken sandwich.
They all looked sooooo good.
I had eaten a late breakfast
the fries.author: Eva C.
the fries.review:
Bacon Bacon Bacon Bacon Bacon! Dank. Wet. Lit. Poppin. Smacks. This place has been bookmarked for a minute, because I LOVE BACON, I just haven't found a chance to try it until now. I'm a fan, I will be back. Price point is typical of an SF restaurant, so expect to spend about $10-15 for a meal.

Came in around lunch on a Sunday, place was packed, but saying that, there isn't much seating to begin with. I would say about 20 seats. But we stood in the short line and ordered pretty quickly. We got the bacon maple scone and the breakfast burrito (regular, not classic). We sat down at one of the tables and waited for our food. I started on the maple bacon scone, I love scones, but I've never been much of a fan of maple bacon, but let me tell you, it was pretty damn good! Not overly dry, not cakey, it was what I expect of a scone. It even had a pile of bacon up top with some maple drizzled over it. YUM. Finally our food came, and I took one look at that breakfast burrito and instantly fell in love. I love when you can see the distinct layers in food, especially my burritos. Much appreciated. Added the Valencia hot sauce (sits on each table, along with Ketchup, sriracha, and mustard). MA DAM. I only had to take 1 bite to tell it was incredible. Juicy. Took another bite to make sure it was real, and boy was it. My friend devoured it in a split, 2 seconds. I saw another table with fries and it looked like perfection as well, nice size with a crispy outer layer, that looked pretty soft inside. Anyways, I will be back to try the fries, the mac and cheese balls, and the chicken sandwich. They all looked sooooo good. I had eaten a late breakfast so I wasn't hungry enough to eat more, otherwise, I would have went in.

Food = dank
Price = normal
Service = good
Seating = limited
Parking = hills + limited

excerpts: The fries itself were kind of dry.
the fries.author: Stephanie K.
the fries.review:
Got delivery from here. It was pretty good but not as good as I expected. 

Breakfast burrito: pretty good with a lot of meat and a tasty toasted tortilla. Kinda wish they has some salsa on the side or something to balance out the flavor. 

Porky fries: pretty good with generous amounts of yummy pulled pork. Wish they gave a little more bacon. The fries itself were kind of dry. 

I would eat here again if I happened to be near it

excerpts: When 'The Fries' that are supposed to come with 'herb and Parmesan' come with a negligible amount of both, what am I really paying 4 dollars for?
A small thing of greasy fries?
Pretty disappointing
the fries.author: Dylan W.
the fries.review: The food here is decent, and everything tastes fine.  But.  When 'The Fries' that are supposed to come with 'herb and Parmesan' come with a negligible amount of both, what am I really paying 4 dollars for?  A small thing of greasy fries?  Pretty disappointing

excerpts: The fries were also not so great and they forgot the blue cheese dip.
the fries.author: Brittany B.
the fries.review: Ordered takeout from here- a breakfast burrito and bacon fries. Was unfortunately thoroughly unimpressed. The burrito was missing avocado included in the description and overall flavor was meh. The fries were also not so great and they forgot the blue cheese dip.

excerpts: They forgot the fries, which I was specifically looking forward to at 10am, and when I called, the guy who answered pretty much shrugged me off.
He said he could refund the cost of the fries and when I asked why he told me that Bacon Bacon doesn't have drivers and Grubhub could not send another one.
the fries.author: Kiwi B.
the fries.review:
I was super hungry at work so I decided to order from Bacon Bacon! I had one of their burritos and bacon cookies a couple years ago at Off the Grid and I thought the food was pretty good. This time, I tried ordering a "chocolate bacon" which is literally chocolate sauce on one slice of bacon; would I order it again? no. For the taste as well as the price ($3). I also ordered a breakfast bowl, and a side of fries just because. I usually check my bag before I walk off from picking up a delivery, but didn't this time. They forgot the fries, which I was specifically looking forward to at 10am, and when I called, the guy who answered pretty much shrugged me off. 
He said he could refund the cost of the fries and when I asked why he told me that Bacon Bacon doesn't have drivers and Grubhub could not send another one. He rushed me off of the phone and started taking someone elses' order without ending the conversation or confirming he got my information.

 I paid $23 not including tips for a slice of bacon and a soggy breakfast bowl, but luckily and deservedly I am getting a refund (after confirming with a second call). I will not eat Bacon Bacon! again. Customer Service 1/5. Taste 2/5 Quality 1.5/5

excerpts: Im still pissed about the fries.
the fries.author: Erica D.
the fries.review:
Tried this place again for hot food. Disappointment again!!!!!!!!!
First of all- the cashier shook his tip jar pretty rudely to the woman in front of us. I found that extremely rude. She was so embarrassed that he did this in front of a very long line, that she walked back and gave him something.

Why else I'm mad?We ordered their parm/ herb fries. When we opened the box they were plain!!!! Nothing on them. Ughhhh. Barely any salt and definitely no cheese or herbs. 

My boyfriend loved their bacon burger. Im still pissed about the fries.

excerpts: The sandwich was ok but the fries were disappointing.
The fries tasted like they were frozen at some point.
They weren't crispy, nor were they soggy.
They were in that weird in between when fries aren't fresh and so they had the texture of cardboard.
Not worth it.
Would I go back?
Only if I had no other options.
the fries.author: Susana T.
the fries.review:
The truck came to SFSU and wasn't prepared to serve. A group of 5 people had waited for about 15-20 minutes for the truck to start taking orders. When one of the girls asked how long it'd be before they're ready, they said some amount of time and the group started walking away. The moment they stepped away, the truck started taking orders. They were pissed (I would've been too. That was messed up!) but I was glad I didn't have to wait for them to order either. 

I had the bacon fried chicken sandwich and the porky fries. The sandwich was ok but the fries were disappointing. The fries tasted like they were frozen at some point. They weren't crispy, nor were they soggy. They were in that weird in between when fries aren't fresh and so they had the texture of cardboard. Not worth it. Would I go back? Only if I had no other options.

excerpts: The fries were cooked & seasoned perfectly.
The pork, yellow peppers & shredded cheese on top completed the fries altogether.
Highly recommend!
It is a big portion, but I was able to finish it b/c
I have a huge appetite.
the fries.author: Trina N.
the fries.review:
They have a sign saying "Bacon Makes Everything Better," & this place indeed made that happen! Came here for Sunday brunch & was really impressed w/ the food

Porky Fries - these were just absolutely delicious! The fries were cooked & seasoned perfectly. The pork, yellow peppers & shredded cheese on top completed the fries altogether. Highly recommend! It is a big portion, but I was able to finish it b/c I have a huge appetite. I suggest sharing this between 2 people b/c it'll fill you up

BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich - absolutely amazing! Taking my first bite into this, I literally rolled my eyes & was in awe. The bread was soft; the pork was so tender & flavorful; the bacon was cooked jst right, not too crispy & not too soft; the bbq sauce wasn't too overwhelming but added some good extra flavor; and the slaw had a nice little crunch. Highly recommend trying as well! 

Overall, I thought the food was really great. Definitely check this place out! I will come back to try their other bacon goodies that they have on the menu

excerpts: Don't think I can try the fries.
The sandwiches are generous in size.
the fries.author: Debbie T.
the fries.review:
What a sandwich! The BBQ pork on a brioche bun was outstanding. Enjoyed the tangy bbq sauce.

The Cuban on a ciabatta roll was good but a little on the salty side. I enjoyed the spicy heat, though.

Gonna try the bacon fried chicken sandwich next time. Don't think I can try the fries.  The sandwiches are generous in size. No dinner for me, tonight!

Very friendly staff.

excerpts: The fries, in my opinion, were fantastic.
the fries.author: Patrick K.
the fries.review:
Sweet baby Jesus, thank you for giving us pigs. 

I came to Bacon Bacon on a Sunday afternoon, having been jonesing for a good burger all week. After a quick search of the web and Yelp - Bacon Bacon seemed to be the best option in the area. Boy, I was not disappointed! 
The menu offered many options for breakfast that looked and smelled delicious on my fellow diners plates, but I had burger on the mind. The breakfast burrito with Chicharrónes I saw 1 table over will definitely be my pick next time though. 
The walkup ordering was super easy and the staff was more than helpful with questions about menu items. If you're looking for a soft drink, your options are limited, but let's be honest you're not coming to a place named Bacon Bacon for the sodie pop. If you're cool with aqua like me, there is a water cooler with cups in the back, so no need to buy a bottle. There are also a variety of teas and coffee beverages if you so choose.
I ordered the Bacon Bacon Double Cheeseburger with fries and it came to about $16. In a quick 8-10 minutes, it was ready. Seating is fairly limited so it was a perfect timeframe to wait for a table. Get a pic riding the pig while you wait!
The burger is prepared to complete perfection - two .5" patties ensconced in a sharp melty yellow cheddar and sauce sitting atop thick cut meaty greasy delicious bacon and sautéed onions all on a soft fluffy brioche roll (the perfect vehicle for all of that deliciousness). The bacon made me believe in bacon again. I didn't consider myself a fan of bacon before coming here, but I have since realized, I just wasn't a fan of the crappy thin, chewy, garbage that surely the pig making it would be ashamed of. Bacon Bacon's bacon is what bacon should be - thick and juicy. This was the best fast casual burger I've ever had - it blows Super Duper, Shake Shack, and Five Guys out of the water.
The fries, in my opinion, were fantastic. They were a basic, thicker cut (not steak fry), with shaved parmesan on top - no salt.

I will most certainly be returning to try other menu items. You get AMAZING food, a huge portion, and friendly service. What more do you need? Maybe a stroller, because when you leave you'll have twin food babies.

excerpts: You'd hope that when the server was told about the cheese on the fries, and was correcting that mistake, they would've stopped and thought for a moment about how to be sure the rest of my spouse's meal was up to par.
the fries.author: Susan L.
the fries.review:
I really supported this business when they were going through the planning issues with the City - not because I like bacon (actually, I try to keep Kosher and am a recovering vegetarian) but because I support small businesses in my neighborhood. I really want this business to succeed, even though it's not ever going to be my cup of tea. 

My spouse has told me he's had Bacon Bacon's turkey burger and enjoyed it in the past. So it was disappointing when my spouse came home from here today, reporting that he'd ordered both a chicken burrito and french fries with NO cheese on either item. My spouse also said when his fries were delivered, they had cheese on them, so they had to make him a second order without cheese. As my spouse unrolled his burrito at home, he found - you guessed it - cheese on it. He called up, told them what had happened, and asked for another burrito without cheese, which he received.

You'd hope that when the server was told about the cheese on the fries, and was correcting that mistake, they would've stopped and thought for a moment about how to be sure the rest of my spouse's meal was up to par. But that didn't happen. 

Every business has its bad days, and maybe today was theirs. When there's so many good food offerings in our neighborhood, it is hard for me to imagine my spouse ordering from Bacon Bacon again any time soon.

excerpts: The fries were perfect.
My son liked the grilled cheese with Bacon.
Order your to go.
Restrooms are behind the counter through the double doors upstairs to the left.
I'll be back to order something better.
Efficient service.
Clean.
Worth a shot as well as a return...
oh grab the lemonade.
the fries.author: ann s.
the fries.review: I regret ordering the Cobb Salad...should have gone for that breakfast burrito everyone raves about. My husband enjoyed his double cheese burger. The fries were perfect. My son liked the grilled cheese with Bacon. Order your to go. Restrooms are behind the counter through the double doors upstairs to the left. I'll be back to order something better. Efficient service. Clean. Worth a shot as well as a return...oh grab the lemonade.

excerpts: We asked for well done fries which they followed and the fries came out very nicely and tasted great.
the fries.author: Rico R.
the fries.review:
I had the breakfast burrito - it was OK, nothing spectacular. There was not that much bacon in it. For a place called Bacon Bacon, there should be ALOT of bacon, but this is not the case here.

The bacon fries was another case of lacking in bacon. It was more like Carnitas with some bacon bits. We asked for well done fries which they followed and the fries came out very nicely and tasted great.

Another low mark is their system - they will take orders from a long line of customers, cook a lot of burritos, prepare all the sandwiches ordered then release them in no particular order. You got your food randomly. We ended up being served last in a batch of about 10 people and we were there first!

Not worth going back.

excerpts: these sandwiches and the fries could have been served sans bacon in any other restaurant and they would have been MAGNIFICENT.
the fries.author: Stephen R.
the fries.review:
It's hard to beat an eatery that focuses on bacon and delivers it in meals of high quality and thoughtful design. Our first go around with Bacon Bacon was via their mobile truck which has since burned to the ground (not a grease fire, but an engine fire. New one on the way we hear), and that was amazing. Amazing savory combinations, some with excellent spicy options. For me, it just did not get much better than that.

Now, visiting the store, the excellence continues. I had the the Hot Italian. My lady had the fried chicken sandwich. We split a side of Porky Fries.

Here's the thing: these sandwiches and the fries could have been served sans bacon in any other restaurant and they would have been MAGNIFICENT. But here, they are thoughtfully paired with bacon and their magnificence increases exponentially. 

If you like great lunch [or breakfast] food at a reasonable price, the Bacon Bacon is worth a visit. If you like great lunch [or breakfast] food at a reasonable price and also love bacon, THEN YOU MUST VISIT.

excerpts: Also, the fries were supposed to come with Parmesan and herbs.
But they were just limp fries.
Maybe you would have a better experience at the restaurant.
the fries.author: Kenzie T.
the fries.review: I went to the food truck at off the grid. I had been looking forward to trying this place for a long time. I ordered the burger and fries. Unfortunately, they forgot the bacon jam and cheese on my burger. So it just tasted like an over cooked burger with bacon on it. Also, the fries were supposed to come with Parmesan and herbs. But they were just limp fries. Maybe you would have a better experience at the restaurant.

excerpts: As a bacon lover I had high expectations but unfortunately during this visit the bacon fried chicken sandwich was overcooked and the fries were hard and bland.
A disappointing experience in this instance
the fries.author: Ray H.
the fries.review: As a bacon lover I had high expectations but unfortunately during this visit the bacon fried chicken sandwich was overcooked and the fries were hard and bland. A disappointing experience in this instance

excerpts: I went in the morning for the breakfast burrito, came across the food truck on Fishermans' Wharf and decided to have the fries.
Both were very delicious.
the fries.author: C B.
the fries.review: I went in the morning for the breakfast burrito, came across the food truck on Fishermans' Wharf and decided to have the fries. Both were very delicious.

excerpts: I'm not a huge fries person but the fries were delicious.
The staff was very friendly and talked with us for a while.
I really wish there was one close to where I live because it would be a regular stop for me.
the fries.author: Dave C.
the fries.review: I love Bacon! so I was really excited about trying this place. It lived up to all the hype that I heard from my friends. I had the bacon burger and fries. The burger had a great flavor and the bacon was cooked perfectly. I'm not a huge fries person but the fries were delicious. The staff was very friendly and talked with us for a while. I really wish there was one close to where I live because it would be a regular stop for me.

excerpts: I also shared an order of the fries which had pulled pork, bacon and hot peppers on it.
the fries.author: Tae K.
the fries.review:
Went there today with a friend and his infant daughter for lunch, still feeling the after effects but was it ever worth it. I got the Bird, which had turkey, chicken fried bacon (oh yeah), avocado and purple cabbage. It was meaty, filling and delicious. I also shared an order of the fries which had pulled pork, bacon and hot peppers on it. It was a guilt-inducing amount of food and calories, but again, worth it. 

The space is clean and welcoming (though a bit small) and it required a lot of hill climbing to get there, but that's probably a good thing considering the food. The staff was incredibly friendly as well. My friend's daughter made a bit of a mess, spilling some food on the floor, and they didn't bat an eye, just thanked us for coming by. 

Will definitely be heading back there soon to try out some of the other sandwiches.

excerpts: While the pork belly was indeed tasty and seasoned the fries just perfectly.
The fries, themselves, seemed a tad stale.
the fries.author: Jason N.
the fries.review:
I stumbled across this while looking for vegetarian friendly restaurants.

This is NOT for vegetarians by any means. As soon as you walk through the door, your senses are blasted with the aroma of delicious bacon. I was taken aback by the lack of seating in the establishment (I remember 4 stools in the entire seating area)

I had ordered the Hot Italian, and while it does not have any bacon strips in it. The sandwich itself was quite delicious with a generous serving of pork belly layered inside. On top of that, I had an order of pork belly fries. While the pork belly was indeed tasty and seasoned the fries just perfectly. The fries, themselves, seemed a tad stale.

My friend, on the other hand, ordered the Free Bird, which she complained was too dry and the bacon-fried bird lacked any taste of bacon.

Perhaps it was an off day for them or the fact that we did not order anything with a pure strip of bacon.

I am still intrigued to try other items on their menu, but in due time.

excerpts: The fries were nice and crispy, but not enough of them.
The pork thrown in was a good sampling, but nothing really stood out.
Next time I'll just order the regular fries because I probably will get enough pork on the other menu items.
the fries.author: Andrew G.
the fries.review: Got lucky and arrived in time with no line, by the time our food came out the place was packed.  That was a big bonus.  We ordered the BBQ Pulled pork sandwich and the breakfast burrito, side of porky fries.  The sandwich was packed with three styles of pork, pulled, belly, and bacon.  The sauce was on the sweet side.  The roll nothing special but I didn't feel it was grocery store quality either.  Not the best pulled pork I've ever had, but definitely up there.  The breakfast burrito was very good.  Eggs nice and hot. Needed more avocado, would have paid more if I knew there would be so little.  The side of porky fries was ok, really the reason I couldn't stretch the review to be a five star, that and each item was good but not the best ever.  The fries were nice and crispy, but not enough of them.  The pork thrown in was a good sampling, but nothing really stood out.  Next time I'll just order the regular fries because I probably will get enough pork on the other menu items.

excerpts: My favorites are the Grilled Cheese (of course) and the Porky Fries.
My husband trys something new every time and has yet to be disappointed.
the porky fries.author: Nila B.
the porky fries.review:
Attention Foodies!!!! This place is an absolute must. 

My husband and I stop by anytime we are in the Bay Area, even if it means going out of our way. My favorites are the Grilled Cheese (of course) and the Porky Fries. My husband trys something new every time and has yet to be disappointed. The service is always great and the vibe is always chill. 

If you're in the area and love yourself STOP BY!

excerpts: The porky fries were piled with pork shoulder goodness.
the porky fries.author: Mitzi G.
the porky fries.review:
If you believe that Bacon is good for you, you are guaranteed to be happy here. 
The place is small with limited seating but has an extensive menu offering snacks, sandwiches, and salads with bacon & cheese as the main ingredients.  

I really liked the Cubano- a hot sandwich with 3 kinds of pork, pickles, and mustard on ciabatta. 
The porky fries were piled with pork shoulder goodness. 
And the mac and cheese balls were ooey gooey delish! 

Random fun fact: There's a mechanical pig you should ride!

excerpts: We ordered the Breakfast Sandwich and Breakfast Burrito to split, then the Porky Fries and Bacon Chili to save for later - yes we were feeling ambitious that day.
Our food seemed to take forever to prepare.
There is also not a lot of seating, so you might have to wait around for a bit and snatch a table when someone leaves.
The Breakfast Sandwich was my favorite out of all those choices.
The egg was messy but the flavor was perfect.
How could such a simple sandwich be so good?
Would recommend.
The other foods we got were also good.
Would not recommend saving any of these for later like I tried to do.
the porky fries.author: Stefanie C.
the porky fries.review:
WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE?! The name of Bacon Bacon is like... meat that is so epic it just echoes when you say it once. My boyfriend and I live in the Castro District, so we decided to take a nice Sunday stroll here.

We ordered the Breakfast Sandwich and Breakfast Burrito to split, then the Porky Fries and Bacon Chili to save for later - yes we were feeling ambitious that day. Our food seemed to take forever to prepare. There is also not a lot of seating, so you might have to wait around for a bit and snatch a table when someone leaves. In the meantime, we enjoyed a tasty Hot Havana Latte.

The wait was so worth it though. The Breakfast Sandwich was my favorite out of all those choices. The egg was messy but the flavor was perfect. How could such a simple sandwich be so good? Would recommend. The other foods we got were also good. Would not recommend saving any of these for later like I tried to do.

excerpts: My favorite is the breakfast burrito, and the porky fries are also bomb if you're hungry enough!
the porky fries.author: Tracy C.
the porky fries.review:
Apparently I'm #2 when it comes to Yelp check-ins, so it's about time I wrote a review! 

Bacon Bacon is one of my go-to for quick weekend brunch, especially since I live so close. Not only do they have an amazing selection of bacon-products, but it's also not crazy expensive as brunch can sometimes be. My favorite is the breakfast burrito, and the porky fries are also bomb if you're hungry enough! 

They have a limited amount of seating (4 tables and a bench), so weekends can get a little hectic if you're planning on eating there. But luckily service is pretty fast so people are in and out quickly!

Definitely a must-try if you love bacon. Also try their food truck if you're at off the grid!

excerpts: I  would love to go back and try the porky fries.
Fun atmosphere and excellent staff.
Deliciousness
the porky fries.author: Alicia H.
the porky fries.review: We ordered two burritos, filled with pulled pork, pork belly, coleslaw  and french fries. My sil had the fried chicken sandwich. He loved it. I  had the grilled chicken sandwich. I  would love to go back and try the porky fries. Fun atmosphere and excellent staff. Deliciousness

excerpts: I had the bacon fried chicken sandwich and the porky fries.
the porky fries.author: Susana T.
the porky fries.review:
The truck came to SFSU and wasn't prepared to serve. A group of 5 people had waited for about 15-20 minutes for the truck to start taking orders. When one of the girls asked how long it'd be before they're ready, they said some amount of time and the group started walking away. The moment they stepped away, the truck started taking orders. They were pissed (I would've been too. That was messed up!) but I was glad I didn't have to wait for them to order either. 

I had the bacon fried chicken sandwich and the porky fries. The sandwich was ok but the fries were disappointing. The fries tasted like they were frozen at some point. They weren't crispy, nor were they soggy. They were in that weird in between when fries aren't fresh and so they had the texture of cardboard. Not worth it. Would I go back? Only if I had no other options.

excerpts: We shared the porky fries which were good but missing salt.
the porky fries.author: Autumn Y.
the porky fries.review:
Just OK. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back. 

Food: pretty good. I got the burger. They asked how I wanted it done and I said medium, it came out well done. It wasn't the worst but it too dry for me to really love it. D got the Cuban which he really enjoyed. We shared the porky fries which were good but missing salt. If you've been to Lardo in PDX, they're similar but not as tasty. 

Service: eh. The guy that took our order was great. He was friendly, efficient and pleasant. There was also a girl working the counter and her attitude made me so uncomfortable that I tried to avoid all interaction. When I asked for a side of mayo for my overdone burger, she looked at me like 'how dare you ask me for anything?!'. Yeah- NOPE.

excerpts: Will definitely try the porky fries next time.
the porky fries.author: Sherri C.
the porky fries.review: Quaint little place in a neighborhood. So different. LOVED LOVED LOVED our food. Got the chicken fried bacon sandwich with regular fries. 100% A++++. Will definitely try the porky fries next time.

excerpts: I ordered the porky fries and the daily special which was a cuban sandwich and boy were both great.
Porky fries were covered in pork and cheese, very good amount of fries as well.
the porky fries.author: Josue V.
the porky fries.review: Amazing food! Came here for a Sunday brunch and was very impressed with the food quality and taste. The restaurant is pretty small but luckily my gf and I were able to find seats quickly. I ordered the porky fries and the daily special which was a cuban sandwich and boy were both great. Porky fries were covered in pork and cheese, very good amount of fries as well. The cuban sandwich was really good, great cuts of meat and the bread was freshly made and soft. Overall really happy with my experience here, would highly recommend it!

excerpts: The burger (a double cheeseburger with  needless to say, bacon) was perfect, and the porky fries (fries, peppers, bacon, pork shoulder) were astonishingly good and filling.
Only slight negative remark, no fountain drinks or refills.
But really, this is a delicious place to have lunch or brunch.
the porky fries.author: Stefano Z.
the porky fries.review: Oh goodness. I thought I couldn't possibly love bacon more than I already did. I was wrong. The burger (a double cheeseburger with  needless to say, bacon) was perfect, and the porky fries (fries, peppers, bacon, pork shoulder) were astonishingly good and filling. Only slight negative remark, no fountain drinks or refills. But really, this is a delicious place to have lunch or brunch.

excerpts: but then the porky fries are necessary to the essential Cuban (u will understand why)then the bacon desserts, sometimes caramel, sometimes chocolate, a bacon flavor chain that u just let happen since u didn't wish to interrupt it anyway...
the porky fries.author: Carmenchu C.
the porky fries.review:
As it is seriously one of my deepest wish in life to Always have a Bacon Bacon as my neighbor no matter where I live and I worry sometimes because they're not ever crowded when I go, and they close early at 3p most days... Why?? Has the neighborhood with all the gatzillion companies and businesses and residential bldgs. And ballpark nearby- Still not discover you?? Maybe it's your very subdued subtle signage, I would miss you too if I was not a bacon bacon foodtruck planned to stalk bersearcher... I had just heard about ur food truck on 11th and had a scheduled attack plan but then found out, whuuth? New Bacon Bacon cafe opened 2blocks away??!! Only then did I really believe in destiny and karmic fate... or that maybe I really am one of the luckiest people alive as some have said. (Tho still not a full believer, definitely there r luckier peep esp. in sf.. but digressin..I'm ok lucky, grateful no matter, Love Life!) in any case, the Bacon is here and he is mine! 

The only taint on the pork train is that I can't go there everyday as its a bit on the spends side for me. Though you have some well priced items I find it impossible not to have the Cuban every time, altho well worth the $10+ sandwych$ but then the porky fries are necessary to the essential Cuban (u will understand why)then the bacon desserts, sometimes caramel, sometimes chocolate, a bacon flavor chain that u just let happen since u didn't wish to interrupt it anyway...

I think there are other items on the menu, I've split halves of other sandwiches when I can spare/share the Cuban. Love the bacon fried chicken too.. but beyond that, me and my bf find it hard to venture further. He's pretty stuck on the Cuban too. It's not the absolute best sandwich in the world necessarily, as this town is not lacking spots, but the special Cuban flavorings+ extra crispy crunchy bits of fried belly with just the right amount of grease light  +perfect light dusting of salty +convenience of proximity... ok so I am absurdly rav right now, no bkfst yet, need to food shop and waiting impatiently for 11a lunch menu to start...  but still I'm only exaggerating slightly.... for today as with most days, it is give me Cuban or give me death..

And peeps are super nice there too, they insisted on cooking a fresh batch of sandwiches when I was really late for a pickup order the other day.. rare... tho wouldn't blame them if they ate it;) i just truly hope biz has picked up as they should not ever close shop until we've agreed where to move together next! ps:not promoting pork eating as the piggies are damn cute and smart! Intellect of a 3yr human supposedly... so sorry, I will try to abstain.. i will try not to be a weak human....hmmm...uh oh..stomach grumble...

excerpts: The porky fries, breakfast burrito and the daily special, which is a cuban sandwich, are delicious!
the porky fries.author: Alicia R.
the porky fries.review: Favorite spot in the neighborhood. I get my morning coffee here and order greasy breakfast food for my weekend hangovers. The porky fries, breakfast burrito and the daily special, which is a cuban sandwich, are delicious! But the real treat, in my opinion, is the bacon fried chicken sandwich. Bacon Bacon is a local treasure and just a gem.  Delicious food, nice folks, great sense of humor. Stop by their storefront if you're in the area - yummy sandwiches, great bacon, everything I have tried so far has been wonderful! Bring by your friends and family, I'm sure they'll love it!! Don't take my word for it, just have a look at their other reviews and you'll see that this small  restaurant is a gem.

excerpts: Neither dish I had (the grilled cheese and the porky fries -- which is fries with bacon, pork shoulder, and cheese) was particularly memorable.
A little too greasy, a little too much bread (yes, even for a bacon place).
the porky fries.author: Gabe E.
the porky fries.review: Meh. Neither dish I had (the grilled cheese and the porky fries -- which is fries with bacon, pork shoulder, and cheese) was particularly memorable. A little too greasy, a little too much bread (yes, even for a bacon place).

excerpts: Anyways, I will be back to try the fries, the mac and cheese balls, and the chicken sandwich.
They all looked sooooo good.
I had eaten a late breakfast
mac and cheese balls.author: Eva C.
mac and cheese balls.review:
Bacon Bacon Bacon Bacon Bacon! Dank. Wet. Lit. Poppin. Smacks. This place has been bookmarked for a minute, because I LOVE BACON, I just haven't found a chance to try it until now. I'm a fan, I will be back. Price point is typical of an SF restaurant, so expect to spend about $10-15 for a meal.

Came in around lunch on a Sunday, place was packed, but saying that, there isn't much seating to begin with. I would say about 20 seats. But we stood in the short line and ordered pretty quickly. We got the bacon maple scone and the breakfast burrito (regular, not classic). We sat down at one of the tables and waited for our food. I started on the maple bacon scone, I love scones, but I've never been much of a fan of maple bacon, but let me tell you, it was pretty damn good! Not overly dry, not cakey, it was what I expect of a scone. It even had a pile of bacon up top with some maple drizzled over it. YUM. Finally our food came, and I took one look at that breakfast burrito and instantly fell in love. I love when you can see the distinct layers in food, especially my burritos. Much appreciated. Added the Valencia hot sauce (sits on each table, along with Ketchup, sriracha, and mustard). MA DAM. I only had to take 1 bite to tell it was incredible. Juicy. Took another bite to make sure it was real, and boy was it. My friend devoured it in a split, 2 seconds. I saw another table with fries and it looked like perfection as well, nice size with a crispy outer layer, that looked pretty soft inside. Anyways, I will be back to try the fries, the mac and cheese balls, and the chicken sandwich. They all looked sooooo good. I had eaten a late breakfast so I wasn't hungry enough to eat more, otherwise, I would have went in.

Food = dank
Price = normal
Service = good
Seating = limited
Parking = hills + limited

excerpts: And the mac and cheese balls were ooey gooey delish!
mac and cheese balls.author: Mitzi G.
mac and cheese balls.review:
If you believe that Bacon is good for you, you are guaranteed to be happy here. 
The place is small with limited seating but has an extensive menu offering snacks, sandwiches, and salads with bacon & cheese as the main ingredients.  

I really liked the Cubano- a hot sandwich with 3 kinds of pork, pickles, and mustard on ciabatta. 
The porky fries were piled with pork shoulder goodness. 
And the mac and cheese balls were ooey gooey delish! 

Random fun fact: There's a mechanical pig you should ride!

excerpts: Order: Cuban sandwich and Mac and cheese balls
The mac and cheese balls were a little salty dipped in the sauce.
Not over powering
mac and cheese balls.author: Christopher S.
mac and cheese balls.review:
Order: Cuban sandwich and Mac and cheese balls 

The mac and cheese balls were a little salty dipped in the sauce. Not over powering but when I took a bite my partner and I both said it without thinking. 

The Cuban was to die for the meat was tender and felt like it was cooked for 8 hours plus. The bread was nice and toasted the bell peppers were a nice twist 

This place is a nice spot to drop by for a bite on your way to somewhere. 
Sitting is nice also.

excerpts: Also had the fried Mac and cheese balls.
This obviously isn't a place to try if eating healthy.
mac and cheese balls.author: Emily F.
mac and cheese balls.review: Such a great place. Have been multiple times for breakfast and once for lunch now. I had the fried chicken sandwich and was so great! The flavors were on point and the chicken was nice and crisp. Also had the fried Mac and cheese balls. This obviously isn't a place to try if eating healthy. The breakfast is also great but the breakfast burrito has always been so extra greasy I wouldn't recommend that. Will definitely be back sometime tho!

excerpts: , I also got the bouquet and was slightly disappointed that they weren't rolled up pieces of bacon to look like roses (but at least they were perfectly crispy and delicious).
the bouquet.author: Patricia C.
the bouquet.review:
Small restaurant off of Haight x Ashbury serving up my favorite food: bacon. I had the burger and it was pretty good, I also got the bouquet and was slightly disappointed that they weren't rolled up pieces of bacon to look like roses (but at least they were perfectly crispy and delicious).

Seating is kind of hard, and the bathrooms are awkwardly upstairs and accessible through the kitchen, but this place is good if you live nearby or have an extraordinary craving for bacon.

excerpts: Try the Bouquet for your fill of crispy bacon every time.
Even excellent coffee and a sunny, relaxing atmosphere.
Go out of you way for Bacon, Bacon!
the bouquet.author: Andre M.
the bouquet.review: Never disappoints. Consistently amazing every time. The Almost Veggie Sandwich is a mixture of always perfectly fresh bread, sautéed veggies, a fried egg (slightly runny) and, of course, bacon. Try the Bouquet for your fill of crispy bacon every time. Even excellent coffee and a sunny, relaxing atmosphere. Go out of you way for Bacon, Bacon!

excerpts: I was skeptical about The Chocolate Covered Bacon, but it was delicious!
the chocolate covered bacon.author: Elizabeth S.
the chocolate covered bacon.review: Ordered (via Postmates) The California Bacon BBQ Burrito and The Cuban - both were very good! I was skeptical about The Chocolate Covered Bacon, but it was delicious!

excerpts: The chocolate covered bacon was also good but not that great.
the chocolate covered bacon.author: Angel V.
the chocolate covered bacon.review: The food and service was good but I'm a big bacon fan so I expected great bacon and didn't get that. Honestly was disappointed because I couldn't taste the bacon in the cali BBQ bacon burrito I got. I got also got the fried mac and cheese bacon balls and barley taste bacon but they were pretty dam good. The chocolate covered bacon was also good but not that great.

excerpts: She got the chocolate covered bacon and loved it.
They also had tshirts to purchase.
It was my birthday and they gave me a free treat and took a picture of me on the mechanic pig to put on their wall.
On the other hand there was obviously no options for my vegan friend at Bacon Bacon!
the chocolate covered bacon.author: Julie W.
the chocolate covered bacon.review: The staff here are super friendly.  My friend is a bacon lover and was excited to go and see what they had.  She got the chocolate covered bacon and loved it.  They also had tshirts to purchase.  It was my birthday and they gave me a free treat and took a picture of me on the mechanic pig to put on their wall.  On the other hand there was obviously no options for my vegan friend at Bacon Bacon!

excerpts: Sit back and relax with a latte at the window seat and enjoy the calm atmosphere!
latte.author: Amber G.
latte.review: Bacon Bacon is the PERFECT name for this eatery. The food was so tasty and the bacon jam was to die for! Sit back and relax with a latte at the window seat and enjoy the calm atmosphere!

excerpts: I also got a horchatta tea latte which was a equal balance of sweetness and cinnamon.
latte.author: Kristi A.
latte.review:
This place is tucked in the midst of a neighborhood, but it's a good 15 minute walk from the nearest bus stop. 

My boyfriend and I decided to go here because we both love bacon and we weren't disappointed. This small cafe is all about the bacon, they even have a fun pig ride for kids and adults to ride on. 

My boyfriend and I decided to come here for breakfast because their lunch menu wasn't that diverse (it had mostly burgers) and we felt their breakfast menu was more interesting. I ordered some bacon tacos ($3) and my boyfriend got their breakfast bowl ($7). 

I also got a horchatta tea latte which was a equal balance of sweetness and cinnamon. It was probably the best I ever had and would probably come back again for it.

The bacon taco and breakfast bowl tasted almost the same with the filling. The filling was egg, bacon, and avocado which was good. The tortilla that came with the taco wasn't toasted and came with 2 mini tortillas so I ate some of my boyfriend's breakfast bowl. 

Overall, it was pretty decent meal and we enjoyed ourselves. The neighborhood is fairly safe, there's 0 homeless people loitering around and I saw many parents hanging out with their children around.

excerpts: Best breakfast burrito with the best almond Chai latte I ever had.
Using superlatives
and I'm not American.
Crazy
latte.author: Kris D.
latte.review: Best breakfast burrito with the best almond Chai latte I ever had. Using superlatives and I'm not American. Crazy

excerpts: In the meantime, we enjoyed a tasty Hot Havana Latte.
latte.author: Stefanie C.
latte.review:
WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE?! The name of Bacon Bacon is like... meat that is so epic it just echoes when you say it once. My boyfriend and I live in the Castro District, so we decided to take a nice Sunday stroll here.

We ordered the Breakfast Sandwich and Breakfast Burrito to split, then the Porky Fries and Bacon Chili to save for later - yes we were feeling ambitious that day. Our food seemed to take forever to prepare. There is also not a lot of seating, so you might have to wait around for a bit and snatch a table when someone leaves. In the meantime, we enjoyed a tasty Hot Havana Latte.

The wait was so worth it though. The Breakfast Sandwich was my favorite out of all those choices. The egg was messy but the flavor was perfect. How could such a simple sandwich be so good? Would recommend. The other foods we got were also good. Would not recommend saving any of these for later like I tried to do.

excerpts:
Delicious Breakfast Burrito 
Amazing Cuban Latte.
latte.author: Cynthia P.
latte.review:
Delicious Breakfast Burrito 
Amazing Cuban Latte. 

Staff was extremely friendly and did a great job on a busy Saturday morning.

excerpts: On top of that I had an incredible iced Havana latte (mixed with condensed milk).
It honestly is the best iced latte I've ever had.
latte.author: Patrick Gabriel L.
latte.review:
All things wrapped, covered, and associated with bacon is heavenly.

Since my first father's day coincided with my son's sixth birthday my wife had the beautiful task of finding a breakfast spot that would satisfy both of our stomachs. Naturally, she pulls through and finds the bacon bacon cafe. Note my son and I tried this fine cuisine last year at Eat Real via it's food truck. To say the least it's one of our most favorite trucks.

Aeden enjoyed their breakfast sandwich while I got my favorite breakfast item, a breakfast burrito. At $7 it's reasonably priced and filled perfectly. No rice or potatoes which was fine by me. Satisfying, not overwhelming. In my college days this would have been disappointing, however, as a father being more mindful of my diet this was a worthwhile treat. 

On top of that I had an incredible iced Havana latte (mixed with condensed milk). It honestly is the best iced latte I've ever had. I even wondered for a second if some bacon was sprinkled for good luck ;)

The cherry on top or better yet the apple in the pig's mouth were our parting gifts. The young man staffed as the cashier that morning was a wonderful host. Warm smile and greetings for everyone. Anyway, I bothered him with plenty of questions/conversation during his shift and mentioned why we came to the cafe. As we were leaving he gave my son a piece of chocolate covered bacon for the road and for me a free sandwich card to use at their fisherman's wharf location.

It was a generous gift for my son and to include me was a bonus (Thank you again if you happen to read this review!). These are the kind of gestures that should not go unnoticed and encourages me to return to try the rest of their tasty menu.

excerpts: I'm not a coffee drinker, but I also have it on good secondary authority that they make a mean latte.
latte.author: Pat M.
latte.review:
Wait, how have I not reviewed this place before? Since they moved into the neighborhood, we've had them in heavy rotation for weekend breakfasts/lunches. We also hit their food truck pretty frequently at Off the Grid in the Haight on Thursday, where their hamburgers frequently play the role of "only thing our toddler will eat at the food trucks."
I won't waste your time by noting that pretty much everything but the croissants has bacon in it, but I will note that my favorite items are the breakfast sandwich and the tuna sandwich. I've tried just about everything else on the menu at this point, and I have yet to have a bad item. I'm not a coffee drinker, but I also have it on good secondary authority that they make a mean latte.

excerpts: While I didn't order coffee, I did see a few people only walk in for their java (drop and latte/cappuccino)
latte.author: Kaitlin F.
latte.review: An impromptu trip past Bacon Bacon made for an excellent post-run in Golden Gate park. Out of the two items we ordered (Bacon breakfast sandwich and breakfast bowl) the sandwich was the winner. Perfectly fried egg where the yolk soaks into the bacon and roll. The avocado on the pulled pork bowl was a little disappointing but good mix of protein. While I didn't order coffee, I did see a few people only walk in for their java (drop and latte/cappuccino)

excerpts: (can I get a bacon caramel latte though?!)!
latte.author: Melissa C.
latte.review:
My boyfriend and I have been to their truck over a year ago and really enjoyed their grilled cheese sandwich. It's simple but delicious... I mean melted cheese, perfectly cooked thick cut bacon, bacon jam (can I buy a jar please?!) and nice toasty bread? I'm not sure how that can not be amazing!

So more recently I've been craving a fried chicken sandwich and felt it was the perfect opportunity to visit their actual cafe... If you walk from 16th and mission bart you will definitely feel like this was a very well deserved meal! Lots of uphill walking..

Anyways..

I got their fried chicken sandwich. To my disappointment it was a little dry.. Not bad though! It was still flavorful thanks to all the smokiness from the bacon. Although it wasn't burnt my chicken did come out black..which seems darker than other people's I've seen walking around with at off the grid and in pictures. That could be the reason for the dryness (but why would you serve it to me if that were the case?).

My boyfriend got their burger plus egg. This threw me by surprise. It was actually realllly good. It was juicy and flavorful..while he liked it he personally preferred my fried chicken sandwich to his burger.

I also got their bacon cookie to go which was good but nothing really special. Needed more bacon and chocolate chips.

The service is awesome and the cafe itself is hard not to love just by walking in... I mean you can ride a mechanical pig and there's bacon everywhere! 

Fun and yummy spot to eat at..definitely want to come back for some more bacon goodness (can I get a bacon caramel latte though?!)!

excerpts: I mostly stop in for coffee or a latte, but have enjoyed a variety of their breakfast noms too.
The scones are probably my favorite - they bake them fresh and they have a great texture.
latte.author: Jessica H.
latte.review:
I love having this place in my neighborhood. 

I mostly stop in for coffee or a latte, but have enjoyed a variety of their breakfast noms too. The scones are probably my favorite - they bake them fresh and they have a great texture. The breakfast burrito is also tasty if you like a LOT of meat. 

As good as the food and coffee bevs are, however, the people are probably the best thing about Bacon Bacon. The people who work there are great and other customers always seem to be enjoying themselves.

excerpts: Plus they make an excellent cafe latte!
Not healthy though.
Lol
latte.author: Lance P.
latte.review: Great place if you love bacon! Plus they make an excellent cafe latte! Not healthy though. Lol

excerpts: I had a latte and a bacon & swiss croissant.
Delicious!!
Good service, relaxed little cafe, and outstanding food with bacon in it.
What more do I need to say?!

latte.review: Soooo good. I had a latte and a bacon & swiss croissant. Delicious!! Good service, relaxed little cafe, and outstanding food with bacon in it. What more do I need to say?!

everything was delicious!
On top of that, service was great.
Would def return.
latte.author: Ana R.
latte.review: We got the cheddar bacon scone, LGBT sandwich, latte and brew and everything was delicious! On top of that, service was great. Would def return.
